story:
Hi, we are the team behind Simmone Standing The Label and we have had the immense pleasure of being invited to showcase our Spring /Summer 2016 Collection on the Fashion Palette New York runway in September.

This is an amazing opportunity not only for the head designer Simmone, but also her team of enthusiastic volunteers who get to be involved in the ‘behind the scenes’ view of a runway show and gain knowledge in developing a story around a collection.

Contributing to this campaign means that parallel to assisting the head designer Simmone showcase her designs on an international platform, you will also be encouraging other young aspiring designers who come to Simmone for mentorship to see that there is always opportunity and a means to follow their dreams!  No ambition is too big or out of reach if you have the passion to make it happen! 



“Something Starting Right Now” Spring Summer collection sought to create a range of garments that are adventurous in the wearing, that tickle the inner girl of the most sophisticated woman and inspire new dimensions of wearing statement pieces.

This is to be Simmone Standing The Label’s second collection and like the previous collection has a unique story all of its own. Thinking ocean shapes mixed with crisp detailing and decisive cuts head designer Simmone has let the whimsy of Disney’s “The Little Mermaid” and the sheer sophistication of Katherine Hepburn amalgamate into her inspiration; androgyny with seashells…

This campaign will release sneak peak shoots showing minor detail, colours and shapes to keep you excited with anticipation but will predominantly be kept secret until it hits the runway in New York shhh… 


To be involved in this amazing opportunity we require $25,000 to cover the following costs:

·  $15,000 entry fee

·  Flights

·  Accommodation

·  Insurance

·  Venue Hire

·  Models

·  Makeup

·  Hair Stylists

·  Advertising

·  Promotion

·  Photography

·  VIP gifting opportunities

·  Celebrities wearing garments 

In the event we exceed our expectations it will provide more areas of opportunity for our enthusiastic team of volunteers with behind the scenes and runway experiences. It will also assist us promote production and enable us to go for stronger marketing prospects. 


All donations will receive a personal email to say thank you for your support. 
All perks from "Thank you post card" onwards will also receive a post card and be "Named AMAZING!" on our marketing website as an extra thank you for your support!! Please indicate if you would not wish to be named on the website- but we still think you are amazing!!

All perks do not include travel, flights or accommodation

All perks will not be honoured until after campaign has ended

Custom designed tote bag made exclusively for New York campaign
Leatherette tote bag with insignia and sheer insert.
Black or White available.
Black leatherette will be paired with black sports mesh.
White leatherette will be paired with an edgy white lace!
We will send you an email on completion of the campaign for your colour preference. Shipping within Australia Free but please provide your address.
[International Contributors please add $20 AUD for shipping]

A $200 gift voucher for a Simmone Standing The Label designed outfit from any of her collections.
This offer is only available for the Come Stand with me in New York campaign so don't miss out! - Buy one for yourself or a friend for Christmas.

Valid for 12 months from receipt of voucher which will be emailed to you.

Well lets face it… YOU ARE! 

To say a very public thank you for your support as every dollar counts we would like to add your name to our list of AMAZING people on our standinginnewyork.com website! 

Couldn't imagine going all this way and not taking amazing photos with our upcoming collection in the iconic streets of New York! 

To say thank you for experiencing this journey with us we want to turn one of these images into a personalised postcard and send it to you anywhere in the world to show our deepest appreciation!! 

Keep a piece of the beginning!! 

This is a new brand that is hoping to build into a well established company in the near future; Simmone would like to offer you a hand drawn sketch of one of her idiosyncratic designs from the "Starting Something Right Now" collection.

This uniquely numbered keepsake will be sketched onto A4 fine linen paper and enclosed in a cushioned postage bag to maintain its integrity. 

[February 2016 delivery date gives time for the designer to create your images as well as work on the next collection. Images will be sent as they become available. If you need it earlier for a special occasion please let us know] 

Simmone has built a wealth of knowledge and is always learning more about the career path she has decided is the only path for her. A coffee with this designer could be an invaluable eye opener for you to pick up tidbits of her incredible journey and business savvy that could translate into your own fashion/creative career and how to start building a platform for yourself! 

Pick your favourite Adelaide cafe or one of Simmone's favourites and spend an hour soaking up her fashion know how. 

[December 2015 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself and designer to catch up for coffee without short timeframe] 

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Fashion always includes travel and for Simmone Standing The Label's team we make frequent visits to Melbourne and Sydney to promote and build our brand. This makes a great opportunity for our team to meet with you and buy you a coffee for that personal thank you touch and discuss not only where we have been but also; Where are you going?

Pick your favourite Melbourne or Sydney cafe or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and spend an our with the team and the head designer soaking up their fashion know how. 

[March 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself, designer and team to catch up for coffee without short timeframe]

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Even as busy busy busy as we will be promoting our brand in the short time we will be in New York, it would be our utmost pleasure to meet you somewhere in Manhattan and shout you a coffee for that personal thank you touch and a little Australian fashion gossip!! 

Pick your favourite Manhattan cafe or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and spend an our with the team and the head designer soaking up their fashion know how.

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Simmone Standing The Label has been privileged enough to build a team of enthusiastic, knowledgable and humorous fashion devotees that would love for you to accompany us on one of our hot lunch dates as part of the team; discuss fashion, photography, opportunities and share with us your story and where you would like to see yourself going on your own creative path. 

Soak up the afternoon at one of the head designers favourite cafes or restaurants in Adelaide and let us shout you lunch to say thank you!!

[March 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for yourself, designer and team to catch up for lunch without short timeframe]

(Please read "Coffee with designer - Adelaide" first) 

Simmone Standing The Label has been privileged enough to build a team of enthusiastic, knowledgable and humorous fashion devotees that would love for you to accompany us on one of our hot lunch dates as part of the team; discuss fashion, photography, opportunities and share with us your story and where you would like to see yourself going on your own creative path. 

Pick your favourite Manhattan cafe/resturaunt or let Simmone Standing The Label pick and soak up the afternoon with our team and their Australian fashion know how and let us shout you lunch to say thank you!!

Get involved behind the scenes on a Simmone Standing The Label campaign shoot! 

See how a creative vision is translated in front of a camera and the whole process that makes the shoot a success for high quality branding images. These photo shoot days are high energy but a lot of fun and are generally a full day process!! 

Come share in the teams adventure, work and camaraderie with food provided and the opportunity to see collections before they are released!! 

[July 2016 delivery date gives flexibility for more photo shoot opportunities for you to attend]

Have you ever dreamed what it would be like to hang out backstage at a fashion show and receive the VIP treatment? 
If you decide you want to be one of the high end contributors and take part in this unique perk, Simmone Standing The Label's team would love to invite you backstage to hang out with the models and the team, get your hair and makeup done by our amazing beauty artists, share in the food, wine and camaraderie with the team and then to complete the experience sit front row with your own name board side by side with the fashion elite on the runway!!! 
This experience will be exclusive to Simmone Standing The Labels upcoming shows after New York that will be held in Australia; travel expenses, flights and accommodation are not included. Minimum 2 months notice will be given for dates. 
Inclusive to the VIP Experience we would also like to offer you a 20% discount on your choice of Simmone Standing The Label garments, to help you dress like the VIP that you are! 
[This perk has been given an end date of July next year and availability for a further 12 months after the campaign has ended as showcases are booked due to demand. This timeframe also provides you with more showcase options as you may not be able to make each one. You will be provided with a personal invitation and notice of upcoming showcases minimum of two months prior to the event]
*As Simmone Standing The Label is a South Australian based brand, showcase opportunities will predominately be in Adelaide. 

Designed and produced solely in Adelaide Australia Simmone Standing The Label is a new clothing line that launched in late 2014 in conjunction with winning the Adelaide Fashion Festival Emerging Designer Award.

It is very important to the head designer that each piece is unique and makes a statement all of its own, she likes them to be thought provoking and inspire the woman that wears it to stand out from the crowd.

“She is the kind of person who loves current trends but doesn’t compromise her own flair and direction by following clique fashion ideals” 


Simmone Standing, head designer and founder of Simmone Standing The Label decided early in 2014 to utilise her 20 years of fashion “affliction” and garment development knowledge to launch this brand with a fresh direction and innovative ideas and the desire of inspiring young creative individuals.

After making the logical decision to launch this new brand, Simmone was encouraged to enter the Adelaide Fashion Festival’s Emerging Designer award; where upon winning she established recognition for her idiosyncrasy, refined cut and innovation.

Utilising the knowledge gained in the development of the brand Simmone has become driven by the purpose of building a business that offers support as well as creating exposure and opportunity for aspiring young designers and creatively minded individuals; a business that shares resources and provides business experience.

Looking into the future for the brand, Simmone and her team's prominent goal is to branch out and stock Simmone Standing The Label in high end boutiques around Australia and internationally.  


Follow our story further and keep updated with everything that happens with the brand and our New York campaign on all our social media platforms

Stay connected with our story, our team of enthusiastic volunteers and all our adventures that build our brand.

Understandably contributing financially is not always an option for some, however there are so many other ways for you to help our campaign and connect with us on a more meaningful level. Please share this campaign through the Indiegogo share tools or through our social media links!

Tell your friends, tell your family, hey even tell the guy that makes your coffee!!

Any help you can give will make our campaign amazing and would be greatly appreciated!! 


If you have any suggestions for rewards or feedback on our campaign we would love to hear from you! 


Marketing: www.standinginnewyork.wordpress.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/pages/Simmone-Standing-The-Label

Instagram: @simmone_standing_the_label

Hashtag: #simmonestandingthelabel #sstlexclusive #startingsomethingrightnow


Simmone Standing The Label has created an elaborate marketing campaign with a broad outreach for their lead up to and during our New York showcase that utilises a strong web presence as well as social media and external interviews.

Simmone Standing The Label would like to invite you to take up the opportunity to support our brand as well as promote your company by becoming a sponsor.

Please email us at brandmanager@simmonestanding.com.au for our sponsorship proposal and marketing plan. 


Simmone Standing The Label’s Head Designer Simmone and her wonderful team would like to thank you for your contribution helping the brand.


A special thanks also goes out to all the people who have contributed to the launch of the campaign: 

Videographer: Kane Overall

Model/Agency: Alana from Hermes Models

MUA: Makeup by TJ Weir, Eleni Tekeste

Team: Kurtis Harrison, Be Za, Juli Gibson, Lois Byrne, Abby Hailu, Eleni Karamanis, Lidia Ielasi, Dianne Flego


Website: www.simmonestanding.com.au

Follow the team: www.standinginnewyork.wordpress.com

Instagram: @simmone_standing_the_label

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Simmone-Standing-The-Label


The Advertiser: http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/entertainment/confidential/adelaide-designer-simmone-standing-wins-adelaide-fashion-festivals-emerging-designer-award-at-the-sa-designers-fashion-showcase/story-fnnspw2t-1227095371824

SA Style: http://www.southaustralianstyle.com/style-hunters/simmone-standing-label/

Glam Adelaide: http://www.glamadelaide.com.au/main/the-sa-designers-showcase-was-an-impressive-event/

Attitude Magazine: Page 19 http://issuu.com/ripituppublishing/docs/aa21

Wilddarts: http://www.wilddarts.com/events/sa-designers-showcase/

Caity Says: http://caityj-says.blogspot.com.au/2014/12/s-t-n-d-i-n-g.html

This is Radadelaide: http://www.thisisradelaide.com.au/rad-life/2014/11/17/simmone-standing-the-label

The Adelaidian: http://theadelaidian.net/simmone-standing-the-launch/

The Gracious Life: http://www.thegraciouslife.com.au/blog/simmone-standing-the-label-the-launch/

story:
A year ago I bought my first SEADOO Spark, with the idea of exploring the waterways that Canada and the Great Lakes have to offer. The only problem I now faced was: Cargo Space. Yes, I could have bought a boat but I don't have the space to store it. 

So this  got me thinking... is there an accessory I could get that would take my beach chair, camping equipment, cooler etc...So I went searching for something that could solve this... and I stumbled upon this, The HydroTrailer. I was super excited, but the excitement was short-lived. Production stopped in 2012. I contacted every dealer I could to see if anyone had one left... but no-one did, I was told the manufacturer just didn't have an interest in making them anymore either... so I called him and he agreed to sell me the moulds and all excess inventory so I could make my own... 

My brain started thinking again... is there a market for them and if so how big... In the U.S. alone 47900 new PWC's were sold last year and there are approx 1.2mill avid PWC riders in the U.S. too.... 22% of the adult population are avid campers or outdoor enthusiasts. So if my math is correct  there is a huge market (264000 PWC users are avid explorers/campers etc)... Now I know that I can't sell to all 264000 folks at once, but that was a big enough number for me to launch this campaign and ask for your support and contributions.

Why Crowdfunding?
To help me raise the capital for Manufacturing costs and Safety Testing/Certification... I have invested my own time and money thus far, in various ways. I continue to explore avenues to make this a success, but the other options are expensive and at the end of the day those costs get passed on to the consumer through significantly inflated pricing etc... I don't want to do that. I want to deliver a top quality, safe and reliable product at a fair price. Yes, I want Seahorse Trailers to be known for its fairness customer support and service. Old School Values, (you can thank my parents for instilling these)
So please please please do me this favour and visit www.seahorsetrailer.com and click the share links on the landing page... If you feel compelled to offer additional support by way of a $1, $5, $10 or more Contribution I would be forever grateful and appreciative. 

Your Support would go a VERY LONG WAY, Thank you.

What is the Seahorse?


The SEAHORSE HydroTrailer  converts your watercraft into the ultimate in outdoor adventure. Now you can get away to those remote areas - and bring everything you may need along. Just load everything into the HYDRO-TRAILER. With 11 Cubic feet of storage and up to 200lbs of cargo, you will find yourself roaming away to beaches and remote camping spots, while still indulging in the thrill of your PWC.

Why the HYDRO-TRAILER?


The HYDRO-TRAILER reduces the risk of boating accidents caused by overloading and improper loading. In 2014, there were an estimated 1400 personal watercraft accidents reported in Canada and USA. Overloading and improper loading were cited as causes in 17% of all reported accidents. That's a staggering 238 preventable injuries or deaths. What's even more frightening is that this number is on the rise (up 10.6% from 2013 statistics)

Not what you'd expect for a day out on the water. 

Options 

The standard model HYDRO-TRAILER will come in white with black trim. 
Upgrade your HYDRO-TRAILER to include a Cooler or two 5 Gal Fuel Containers, the Beach or Touring models. And for the enthusiast, the Beach and Touring models can be further upgraded with one of 5 colour choices.

Ways You Can Help

The HYDRO-TRAILER needs to be produced with such a high standard of quality but must be affordable and consistent. I have sourced a manufacturer and need to put in an initial minimum order so that I can have this product in time for the 2016 boating season. I can’t order this first batch without your help. When you support us through this campaign you help us immensely.

Please contribute to the successful launch HYDRO-TRAILER by choosing one of the perks. By supporting this campaign today, you are having an impact on boater safety and you are encouraging and securing the creation of jobs.

At the Pro-Rider or Champion Perk level, you are making sure you receive your HYDRO-TRAILER long before anyone else. You are also getting your HYDRO-TRAILER at a very special price.

We know some of you aren't able to contribute, or don't have an interest in boating, but that doesn't mean you can't help: My reach only goes so far beyond my network. Please share this project on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter or send a few quick emails to friends and family. It can go a long way to help ensure the success of this campaign!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word.

THE PLAN

We want you to have the HYDRO-TRAILER available as soon as possible. The plan is aggressive but we are confident in our exceptional vendors that it is achievable. Here is the projected timeline for getting the HYDRO-TRAILER available and on the water.

August/September 2015:  Get tons of new Indiegogo supporters, launch website and spread the word.

October 2015: Safety and quality assurance testing. Finalize the engineering and place the first production order and procurement of raw materials and components.

November 2015: Finalize the assembly, and packaging,

December 2015: Begin fulfillment to our Indiegogo fans, spectators, riders, pro-riders and champions.

January 2016: Introduce HYDRO-TRAILER at Toronto International Boat Show. Launch online sales platform.

Refinements: As the HYDRO-TRAILER goes into production, there will likely be some minor adjustments to improve the final product. Pre-production prototypes will be made for safety certification and testing and allow us to incorporate any adjustments suggested by our experienced partners to ensure you and your HYDRO-TRAILER remain safe on the water.

Fulfillment:  Sometimes things go not as planned such as a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost. Those things could cause a delay. To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will enter the manufacturing stage with at least one back-up supplier for each component.

We will be working with manufacturers who have years of experience delivering excellent products in tremendous quantities. There will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for you, our supporters and customers.

We can't wait to see you on the water and to say thank you for your support here on Indiegogo.

SUPPORT

Can I get a refund?

According to Indiegogo, contributions are non-refundable in their Terms of Use. There will be no refunds as all funds go immediately to
manufacturing.

I don't have the money to support you, what can I do?

Please share our project with all of your friends, we have made it very easy. Visit our website and click on the share links provided.
story_txt:
A year ago I bought my first SEADOO Spark, with the idea of exploring the waterways that Canada and the Great Lakes have to offer. The only problem I now faced was: Cargo Space. Yes, I could have bought a boat but I don't have the space to store it. 
So this  got me thinking... is there an accessory I could get that would take my beach chair, camping equipment, cooler etc...So I went searching for something that could solve this... and I stumbled upon this, The HydroTrailer. I was super excited, but the excitement was short-lived. Production stopped in 2012. I contacted every dealer I could to see if anyone had one left... but no-one did, I was told the manufacturer just didn't have an interest in making them anymore either... so I called him and he agreed to sell me the moulds and all excess inventory so I could make my own... 
My brain started thinking again... is there a market for them and if so how big... In the U.S. alone 47900 new PWC's were sold last year and there are approx 1.2mill avid PWC riders in the U.S. too.... 22% of the adult population are avid campers or outdoor enthusiasts. So if my math is correct  there is a huge market (264000 PWC users are avid explorers/campers etc)... Now I know that I can't sell to all 264000 folks at once, but that was a big enough number for me to launch this campaign and ask for your support and contributions.
Why Crowdfunding?
To help me raise the capital for Manufacturing costs and Safety Testing/Certification... I have invested my own time and money thus far, in various ways. I continue to explore avenues to make this a success, but the other options are expensive and at the end of the day those costs get passed on to the consumer through significantly inflated pricing etc... I don't want to do that. I want to deliver a top quality, safe and reliable product at a fair price. Yes, I want Seahorse Trailers to be known for its fairness customer support and service. Old School Values, (you can thank my parents for instilling these)

So please please please do me this favour and visit www.seahorsetrailer.com and click the share links on the landing page... If you feel compelled to offer additional support by way of a $1, $5, $10 or more Contribution I would be forever grateful and appreciative. 

Your Support would go a VERY LONG WAY, Thank you.
What is the Seahorse?

The SEAHORSE HydroTrailer  converts your watercraft into the ultimate in outdoor adventure. Now you can get away to those remote areas - and bring everything you may need along. Just load everything into the HYDRO-TRAILER. With 11 Cubic feet of storage and up to 200lbs of cargo, you will find yourself roaming away to beaches and remote camping spots, while still indulging in the thrill of your PWC.
  Why the HYDRO-TRAILER?




The HYDRO-TRAILER reduces the risk of boating accidents caused by overloading and improper loading. In 2014, there were an estimated 1400 personal watercraft accidents reported in Canada and USA. Overloading and improper loading were cited as causes in 17% of all reported accidents. That's a staggering 238 preventable injuries or deaths. What's even more frightening is that this number is on the rise (up 10.6% from 2013 statistics)
Not what you'd expect for a day out on the water. 
Options 
The standard model HYDRO-TRAILER will come in white with black trim. 
Upgrade your HYDRO-TRAILER to include a Cooler or two 5 Gal Fuel Containers, the Beach or Touring models. And for the enthusiast, the Beach and Touring models can be further upgraded with one of 5 colour choices.

story:
Who are we? 

We are Lips the Magazine, we being Hanna Scott Corrie, Hannah Huffman, and Cristina Boatman. This all started last summer when Hanna and Hannah met while working at the Standard Grill in the meatpacking district. Hanna a freelancing stylist and Hannah finishing up her BFA in photography at SVA, not sure what to do next with their lives. One thing remained constant sex, and fashion. Talking about it,  looking at it. Whats good sex, whats bad sex? Then feminism, and then sexuality in general.

 We're not sure who came up with the idea of a magazine but we knew that we wanted to start a project together. Hanna knew Cristina from Takamichi Hair, where  Hanna worked as a receptionist for two years. Cristina originally started out as just one of our hair dressers, and then quickly becoming our managing editor. 

Elaborate you say?

Lips the Magazine is a commentary on the boundaries between sex and fashion. Where does one end and the other begin? Rather than ignoring the subject of sex in fashion, and fashion in sex, we represent a platform outside binary lines. We find ourselves amidst a sexual revolution where even the broadest subcultures of sexuality are being recognized and accepted. Lips the Magazine is produced in collaboration with emerging contemporary artists in the New York arts scene: encompassing photographers, stylists, writers, designers, actors, comedians, dancers, painters, and performance artists. Content is focused on embracing the diverse sexualities of our subjects. By working closely with our fellow artistic innovators, we can help draw attention to a topic that demands discussion. We aspire to be a magazine that inspires conversations and incites desires.

Who do we think we are anyway? 

Sex is often used in media as a means for manipulation to get us to buy things, to want things; everything from clothing to hand soap. A plus for pop culture today is that it is beginning to represent different kinds of individuals who's sexualities previously were not recognized. However just simply representing is not enough, we need to help the general public understand LGBT. We hope to create a platform available to the general public as a hope to begin a dialogue, to get people curious. So that LGBT isn't a term of subculture but of just culture in general.

What We Need Money For

  • $5,000 for printing and shipping of Issue no.2
  • $3,000 Studio/Office space
  • $900 legal fees and formation of LLC
  • $675 Trademark/Copyright fees
  • $3,800 Computer 
  • $3,000 Camera Kit
  • $1,000 Design and Layout 
  • $720 Indiegogo fees 
  • $325 for Perks and shipping 

Broke like us? 

If you don't have any money to give...PLEASE SHARE THIS PAGE
We understand that not everyone will be able to donate.  You can still help by getting the word out there! We would love your support via Instagram, Facebook or Twitter. Please feel free to share any of these images and tag @lipsmag or a link to our website www.lipsthemagazine.com.

story:
Hi! I am Danielle The Dressmaker. You can find me at Daniellethedressmaker.com! And Www.iambossbitch.com

I have been designing custom made dresses for women all over the world for 6 years now. Recently I started a trend and its selling very well. I need help to start a small production run right here in Downtown LA! I want to be able to make these dresses accessible to everyone who wants to order them whether you are pregnant, size 2 or a size 14! Your DONATIONS will help me buy all the fabric I need and manufacture 100 reversible dresses from sizes 0-14. The money will go straight to manufacturing costs right here in LA!

I am asking for $6,000 but WHERE IS IT GOING?

Each dress cost about $20-30 to make. 

Fabric per dress is $9 total

Pattern grading

cutting

Business license for my new eCommerce platform = $300 (THAT I BUILT and Maintain!)

Tags and care labels

Distribution is done by me!


The Impact


  • my  project is valuable to the world because it's something missing from the market place. At the same time I will  still put Danielle the Dressmakers signature on it. I will also offer Custom made garments on my site.
  • The first album I posted on FB of 7 reversible dresses I sold them all in one day!

Risks & Challenges

  • Manufacturing in the States can be expensive and a lot of manufacturers don't want to make a small run of less than 1,000. Finding the perfect manufacturer will be challenging but Doable.
  •  I have a huge network of people here in LA who are helping me reach out to everyone in the manufacturing industry.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Use the Indie GO GO Share tools and spread the word to the world!!

story:
Why MinkeeBlue?

Hi, my name is Sherrill Mosee. A few years ago, I came up with the idea for MinkeeBlue Tote Bags. I was working with my nonprofit organization when I noticed student moms struggling to carry everything they needed for school and their children. They needed a purse, diaper bag and book bag. I realized that I was just like them, carrying three bags to work with my purse, laptop bag and lunch bag...and sometimes, I'd put my heels in one of those plastic grocery bags and stick that in my purse. I became totally frustrated and questioned, ‘Why am I carrying all these bags?’ Unfortunately, it's typical to see women carrying more than one bag. Since I couldn’t find a bag on the market that would allow me to carry everything I needed for the day while staying organized, I decided to create one. I put my engineering degree to work and committed to designing and making a fashionable everyday "go to" tote for work and travel that would eliminate the need to carry multiple bags. I am proud to introduce MinkeeBlue with a folding panel inside the bag to keep you organized.

MinkeeBlue Nichet in Black - water repellent nylon and leather trim.

MinkeeBlue Madison in Black - water repellent nylon and leather trim.

So, How Does it Work?

Most tote bags are designed as an "open hole" with pockets. We toss our personal items in the bag only for them to get lost at the bottom of the "black hole". I've designed MinkeeBlue as a functional stylish tote giving you full control of how you want to organize your personal items in the bag. No more messy bags and no more digging! Each Minkeeblue features a patent pending folding panel in the middle of the bag that transforms your bag. When the panel is in its closed position, it creates an upper and lower compartment. You can organize and separate items normally carried in three bags, in one MinkeeBlue. When the panel is in its open position, it becomes a one compartment tote bag. See photos below and watch our videos (check out the video in the Gallery in the menu bar) to see the versatility MinkeeBlue offers. 

MinkeeBlue Madison has a top magnetic closure, making it easy to access items in your bag. 

Folding panel in its open position. We use magnetic snaps to keep the panel attached to the side of the bag. All MinkeeBlue totes include a slip pocket to hold your laptop, tablet, files or reading materials. It fits 13" and 14" laptops.

Folding panel in its closed position creating a top compartment and lower compartment. Optional add-on includes a detachable wristlet coin purse which can also serve as a key fob.

Padded cross-body shoulder strap, lunch bag and detachable wristlet coin purse. 

Optional add-on includes this insulated lunch bag with zipper mesh pocket. This bag can also serve as a toiletry or make-up bag.


MinkeeBlue Madison Tote in Chocolate

MinkeeBlue Madison Chocolate - lower compartment with lunch bag.

MinkeeBlue Nichet in Black with top zipper access to the bag and side zipper access to lower compartment. Nichet has plenty of storage space. It includes a front hidden zipper pocket, slip pocket for your cell phone, side pocket and back slip pocket. Wow!!!


Nichet Gold Apricot - Limited Edition Color 
What We Need & What You Get

We've spent months designing, sourcing materials and working closely with our factory to perfect every detail. Your contributions will go towards manufacturing costs. 

  • We are excited to offer you some exciting perks including our signature patent pending totes. 
  • We have a few "Early Bird" specials. Early contributors will become the first to carry a MinkeeBlue Madison or MinkeeBlue Nichet, two months before others. Check out our perks and order today! 

The Impact

This is our second line of MinkeeBlue bags. We've listened to our customers' feedback and redesigned MinkeeBlue with a focus on using higher quality and lighter weight materials. All totes are made with water repellent and leather materials. They weigh less than 3 lbs when empty and holds a 13" or 14" laptops.

  • We had a successful campaign on another platform and are excited to launch MinkeeBlue on Indiegogo. 
  • We are fully committed to the success of MinkeeBlue. We will continue to push forward to raise funds for manufacturing even if we don't reach our goal through this platform. But we're totally optimistic it will happen.
  • We look forward to making you a happy customer!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge at the moment is staying on schedule so we can send your perks in the time promised.  We are working with a manufacturer overseas, so unforeseen events may arise. We promise to work closely with our manufacturer during production and do everything within our power to ensure an on-time delivery. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether large or small... every contribution counts! We are forever grateful. 

Everyone can help whether you contribute or not. 

Here's how...

  • Spread the word...Help us make some noise! Share MinkeeBlue with all your family and friends and well, dare I say it... people you haven't spoken to in a long time. MinkeeBlue is a great conversation piece. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share on all your social media platforms.

A BIG THANK YOU!

A Big "Thank You" to our team for making all this happen... Elissa Boom, Lenny Bazemore, Denise Dahlhoff, Sean Graney, Jim Cottingham, Kelly Aaron, Amber Dahlquist, Frances Washington, Jovan O'Connor, Rebeca Imperiano and Terese Sydonna.

story:
Let me start this endeavor with a little background.  My name is Tom, I am married to my wonderful wife Tenaya.  We are 32 years old and have four crazy, yet wonderful kids.  I have been obsessed with images and designs for well over ten years and have tried on a smaller scale on a few occasions to start this dream of mine.  It , without a question, takes funding and is really not going to happen unless I put us out there and get the funding that will enable this dream.  I want us to show our children dreams are a good thing, they keep you alive and they inspire you.  We would love to give them a glimpse of what it means to pursue something you just can't let go of.  No matter how long you dream of something we want to show them that even if it doesn't happen overnight you don't give up.  We live in a "now" society and patience can be a virtue.  I know my future contributors your saying " EVERYBODY and there mother wants to start an apparel company."  To that I would say NOT WITH THE INTEGRITY AND PASSION WE DO.  This is  not just about making hipsters look fancy in there "unique outfits". We want to create images and clothing that inspires someone, or provokes thought in some way shape or form.  We want THE ARROWS COLLECTIVE to feel like a club.  That feeling you had going to shows or buying straight edge shirts when you were younger.  You felt unique but also  bonded to others you spotted out and about wearing an identifiable shirt, or hat, etc.  PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE. Check out www.thearrowscollective.co You can also email us at thearrowscollective@gmail.com with any questions or comments. THE ARROWS COLLECTIVE is in its infancy but I promise your contributions will go a long way and I will not disappoint you with the products we make.  


We are asking $2500 dollars. This will help get a full line developed.  It will help with some promotional needs such as banners stickers and display that will help with our appeal in stores as well. We know money is hard earned and valuable trust us. We will not let this be an irresponsible campaign.  We value your trust and regardless of if we miss our goal, make our goal or greatly surpass our goal we will treat it the same with hard work and dedication, not only for our contributors but for our future customers.

Your contribution is not taken lightly and we humbly appreciate and accept every dollar.  You are helping us make a dream come true and that is invaluable.


IF YOU READ THUS FAR....THANK YOU!!!
story_txt: Let me start this endeavor with a little background.  My name is Tom, I am married to my wonderful wife Tenaya.  We are 32 years old and have four crazy, yet wonderful kids.  I have been obsessed with images and designs for well over ten years and have tried on a smaller scale on a few occasions to start this dream of mine.  It , without a question, takes funding and is really not going to happen unless I put us out there and get the funding that will enable this dream.  I want us to show our children dreams are a good thing, they keep you alive and they inspire you.  We would love to give them a glimpse of what it means to pursue something you just can't let go of.  No matter how long you dream of something we want to show them that even if it doesn't happen overnight you don't give up.  We live in a "now" society and patience can be a virtue.  I know my future contributors your saying " EVERYBODY and there mother wants to start an apparel company."  To that I would say NOT WITH THE INTEGRITY AND PASSION WE DO.  This is  not just about making hipsters look fancy in there "unique outfits". We want to create images and clothing that inspires someone, or provokes thought in some way shape or form.  We want THE ARROWS COLLECTIVE to feel like a club.  That feeling you had going to shows or buying straight edge shirts when you were younger.  You felt unique but also  bonded to others you spotted out and about wearing an identifiable shirt, or hat, etc.  PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE. Check out www.thearrowscollective.co You can also email us at thearrowscollective@gmail.com with any questions or comments. THE ARROWS COLLECTIVE is in its infancy but I promise your contributions will go a long way and I will not disappoint you with the products we make.  We are asking $2500 dollars. This will help get a full line developed.  It will help with some promotional needs such as banners stickers and display that will help with our appeal in stores as well. We know money is hard earned and valuable trust us. We will not let this be an irresponsible campaign.  We value your trust and regardless of if we miss our goal, make our goal or greatly surpass our goal we will treat it the same with hard work and dedication, not only for our contributors but for our future customers.Your contribution is not taken lightly and we humbly appreciate and accept every dollar.  You are helping us make a dream come true and that is invaluable.IF YOU READ THUS FAR....THANK YOU!!!

story:
My Life is a Statement

My name is Melinda Mitchell, and I am an entrepreneur. I believe I can change the world. I believe in pushing the boundaries of creativity and ingenuity. I believe in giving back to the community.

I have always looked for an opportunity, job, or business that would fit my beliefs. An opportunity that would allow me to prosper, and give back.  I now have that opportunity in hand. PMG Promotions out of Nova Scotia Canada is looking to franchise her business. PMG Promotions brings together outstanding products, customer service, and fundraising ideas for community efforts in such a way that has inspired me to join the team. Together we can push the creativity boundary, and make statements one tee shirt at a time.

PMG promotions is all about customizable tee shirts, with vinyl transfers. She designs all her own graphics that covers everything from cheer leading to hockey, and can even do organizational logos for group fundraising. I want to bring this fun, creative, prosperous idea here and you can help.

What I need to hit the ground running:
A temperature controlled clam shell tee shirt press- $200-300
Initial tee shirt stock- $2000
Show set up equipment- $300
Show entrance fees- $1000
Website, domain and hosting- $400
Travel and training- $1000
Expenses- $500
Computer for design- $500
(Anything over will be going towards my own vinyl machine- $6000, full color transfer machine- $10,000, and my own hotfix rhinestone machine- $38,000)

Making a Statement

  • With in 5 years I expect to have at least 10 people employed with in the company. At least 3 teams traveling to events, and several working the shop.
  • With in the first 2 years I expect more the 75% of our sales will be for group fundraising.

Leap of Faith

All business has its risks, and I have learned how to minimize these risks. Start off small, work hard and push limits. Never stop learning. The fashion, and promotional trades change on a day to day basis. PMG Promotions has had 8 years to perfect the method, and through PMG I have a mentor, a coach, and years of experience I can pull on at any time if I have issues, or questions.

Customized Support

Join us in changing the world one statement, one tee shirt, one person at a time.

  • Donate now!
  • Share this campaign, Facebook, and other information to help make this go viral.
  • Talk to people. You may have a friend of a friend who has a daughter in volleyball, football, or many other sports, who's team would want custom shirts. You may know of cheer leading competitions and meet ups where I can bring this in as a vendor. Contacts are the best resource of all.

story:
Kowy™ - A New Way to Wear Glasses

Hi, I am Alessandra Marzano, the creator, and founder of Kowy™, I am launching a whole new way to wear glasses!

Since I started  Kowy™ 12 months ago, I have designed and produced several different styles and prototypes. I now need your contribution to bring  Kowy™ to the next level. 

Your contribution will help produce Kowy™ on a larger scale and therefore making it more affordable. Our plan is to purchase a 3D printer, Form 2  which will make prototyping a lot cheaper and faster.

A Kowy™ App is also in the oven just waiting for funding to be built. It will allow people to see how each particular Kowy™ design fits on their frames, either thru a scanner or AI (still in the works). It will also build a community of people who want to share their Kowy™ design ideas and common issues.

I intend to promote young children´s designing skills and creativity. By customizing one a month (to be determined exact dates) with the name of a child from the App. We also plan to Collaborate with designers from all over the World, help causes, and support social issues.  

I do not plan or want to open a shop, I intend to sell online, maybe extend to different marketplaces, such as Etsy and Amazon. I plan to distribute Kowy™ in optical shops and jewelry stores Worldwide.

I would also love to make collaborations with artists, brands and fashion designers. Kowy™ is a new way to express yourself and so it is really an artist canvas. It is displayed on the face so it has to be used with the respect and the responsibility it represents. 

As an entrepreneur, I am also very creative and so there are already about 4 more amazing product to follow our Kowy™ Sport Launch. By contributing with us now you will be part of the beginning of the foundation of an amazing company and brand. Get your very own  Kowy™ pair now at our Indiegogo campaign discount prices. 

Thank you.    

Learn The Advantages of Wearing Kowy™ on Your Eyewear

It is a new way to express yourself. Kowy™ is fun, versatile and it can be sporty or sophisticated. Make a fashion statement by personalizing your glasses with Kowy™.

Some of the  advantages of using Kowy are:

  • Charm your children with interchangeable mix& matching designs and color combinations, and see them having fun with their glasses;
  • Save money and time on buying frames and filling prescription lenses in order to change your appearance;
  • See your teen more confident;
  • Cover unwanted logos on the temples;
  • Market your business wearing and giving away a Kowy™ with your business logo or slogan;
  • Great gift ideas for special Holidays, souvenirs, collectibles and birthdays;

Each Kowy has a patent pending design which attaches to a matching silicone ring, specially made to functionally slide from the tip of your glasses’ temples and hold tight along the sides.

You will receive 4 sizes of the mini rings, called Kowy™ Elos. They were designed with precision to fit every frame size.

 

You simply change the Elos to match your frame with the same Kowy™ design, or change it all and make another match.

 

Use a Kowy™ pair on each side, make a trio or go single. Mix designs, match colors and stack several pieces.

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

During my extensive research on the eyewear industry, I came across several articles about the fact that there are more than 1 Billion people in need proper optical care. Since then, I started collaborating with local ophthalmologists to treat unprivileged families in need.  

You can also contribute, talk to your ophthalmologist and ask if they would be interested in seeing families in need. You can contact a local charity school and connect them.

It is my goal with Kowy™ to bring awareness to this Worldwide issue.

Here at our Indiegogo campaign, I will donate 2% of the proceedings to Vision Spring. One of the most organized and reputable organizations I found doing amazing work around the Globe. 

And this is all just the beginning;  I will continue to working hard to produce outstanding quality products and enhancing people´s lives. 

IGTV Video on children´s eye health and safety month back in August. 

There are many ways you can help. 

Product Names Description 

 

 

Additional Information About Kowy™´s Story 

Welcome to KowyTM, the interchangeable and fun adornment for eyeglasses.

I am Alessandra Marzano, the creator and founder of KowyTM. I am Brazilian born, Naturalized American with an Italian Heritage. A Summa Cum Laude in Marketing, years of experience in many fields including, import/export, fashion and Real Estate. I speak 4 languages and wish I spoke them all. I am an entrepreneur at heart, always having creative business ideas, and a long life dream to build a brand. But nothing until now had made me drop everything in my life to pursue my dream.

My KowyTM idea was the one, which meant everything to me. This product idea gave me a new life direction. It finally made sense to build a name, to build a house of products to enhance people´s lives and a brand which would bring happy moments into our everyday. I decided to pursue this myself, against all odd; not having a lot of capital or help.

KowyTM was one of those ideas which invaded my mind and my thoughts bringing so much passion, I then realized my life would never be the same. I simply got obsessed, so thankfully, here we are!
The idea popped in my mind when at dinner with a friend. I watched at a table next to us, a boy continuously crying, pushing his mom´s hands away who lovingly tried to put on these tiny prescription glasses on the boy´s face. The parents, clearly fatigue and saddened by the situation, had no way of making the glasses more fun or pleasurable to distract the boy´s attention and stay calm.

I then looked at my friend, which coincidently wears prescription glasses, and then BOOMMMM I saw them! I saw them so clearly in my mind! I saw the many different KowyTM flashing thru so fast as a lightning bulb!

I looked back at the boy and (in my mind) and saw him happily playing with different characters and animals and shapes and little mini colorful toys, making the boy not only wanting to wear the glasses but actually getting attached to them.

I sank it in, took a breath while imagining the boy happy playing with his KowyTM, making the parents happy and everyone was back in peace ending the stressful situation. That was it, I had to do them.

KowyTM was born!

Moreover, getting deeper into my research after the fact, I realized how much teenagers often go thru tough times as well when prescribed glasses. They start having issues at school, fights with their friends and even strange episodes at home. Their self-confidence drops, and so does their happiness. Bullying and low self-steam can all be extremely harmful to the individual and consequently those around her (him).

As a woman at 40´s, the inevitable use of prescription glasses is also somewhat near.  I guess I was already dreading this moment and when I watched the boy it was a eureka moment for my issue as well! The use of prescription glasses with jewels and fun styles didn’t seem so boring and upsetting anymore!  And as a fashion lover with an incredible fascination for change, I saw KowyTM taking over all of my glasses temples. Including the sunglasses! Then my creative mind really went wild.

The mesmerizing fashion World

I enjoy and appreciate the world of fashion because of its versatility and power to elevate someone´s self-confidence. A useful and fashionable accessory can improve someone´s life, socially and therefore, personally.

Use your KowyTM on prescription and sunglasses! Mix them, collect them and swap them between your friends. KowyTM is made for bringing happiness to everyone. All over the World!

KowyTM is designed to bring joy to your life!

Let´s make people happy together - one KowyTM at a time! 

Special Thank You

 I would like to especially thank ...

- My mother and father, and my brother Ricardo Machado

- My best friend Howard Birnbaum

- Vanessa Alcântara, Laercio Silva

- Filming - Ricardo Machado and myself

- Video Editing - Aleksandar Milenkovic

- Voice over - William Rice

 - Video and picture cast - Mirian Costa, Tânia Moraes, Maria Fernanda, Laura  Martins, Jorge Quartilho, Ygor da Costa Pinheiro, Natália Brambila, and Camila Pereira

story:
LE MANS Limited Edition

The inspiration behind the T Watches LE MANS watch is the racing drivers from the 1950's and 1960's who raced at Le Mans. The watch has a retro feel, with simple and elegant dial and hands. A style favoured by the gentlemen racers of the period. It is powered by a Swiss ETA mechanical automatic movement. 

The LE MANS watch is limited to 999 watches. 

SWISS MADE

Movement - ETA 2824-2 Automatic movement, 

Water Resistance -100M 

Dial - Black 

Crown - with T-Watches logo

Strap - Antique brown leather strap 

Crystal - Sapphire 

Case: 316L Stainless Steel 40 mm (excluding crown)

Case back - Sapphire exhibition back to view the watch movement

Guarantee - 2-year worldwide warranty

Box - Luxury Real Wood Veneer display box 

The watches are tested for a full 48 hours before leaving the factory

T Watches will retail this watch at £545 from Winter 2018

T-Watches LE MANS Edition

T-Watches LE MANS movement (back)

Images of the T-Watches LE MANS Edition 

 

 

Design Sketch

When designing the LE MANS watch we wanted it to simple and functional with a vintage feel to it. As with all our watches, the LE MANS watch is limited edition to provide exclusivity and rarety. 

Ateliers at work where our prototypes and final production will take place. 

 

T-Watches

T-Watches is a new British brand that creates high-quality SWISS MADE  watches.

T-Watches. Quality handmade Swiss watches. Each watch edition is limited to 999 pieces worldwide. QUALITY. RARITY. VALUE. 

The background to T Watches is a story of passion for great watches matched with a passion for great quality.

Our watches are designed and built to last and to be worn every day, they will look good whether you are out in the wilds, in the boardroom or any other occasion.

story:
Thank you for checking out our campaign! We really appreciate it.

 

Short Summary

Before it became a reality, TYMPCE began as an idea in a garage between two childhood friends Anthony and Joseph. Inspired by their aspirations, history, and the experiences that have accompanied them, the two embarked on their mission.  Anthony and Joseph decided to collaborate and form something unique to its industry and driven by goals that go beyond a premium product. 

 

 


 

The TYMPCE Collection

For our first collection, we are offering four different models to choose from.

 

 

Where is TYMPCE headed?

We want to launch multiple watch collections for both men and women, while maintaining quality at a competitive price.  Our aspirations for TYMPCE go beyond delivering premium quality at a fraction of the cost of what our competitors offer.  In pursuit of growing a collective of individuals who share the same goals of wanting to make a difference, TYMPCE strives to bridge the two worlds of fashion and social action.  In addition to our work in our local communities, we will be donating a portion of our profits to an array of nonprofit organizations that execute innovative methods in finding solutions in major issues throughout the world, beginning with addiction.

 

Watch Specifications:

Case Material:  316L Carbon Stainless Steel

Case Diameter: 41 mm

Band Material: 316L Carbon Stainless Steel/Leather

Band Width: 22 mm

Clasp: Push Button Deployment Clasp

Clasp Material: 316L Carbon Stainless Steel

Dial Window Material: Crystal Mineral Glass

Display: Analog

Movement: Japanese Quartz

Date Function: Yes

Water Resistant: 5 ATM

Warranty

We are so confident in our product that every TYMPCE watch includes a 2 year warranty with your purchase. If something were to happen to your TYMPCE within that time period, we hope you'll send it back to us.

Warranty does not cover:  

The life of the battery

Wear and tear and aging (e.g. scratched crystal; alteration of the color and/or material of non metallic straps and chains, such as leather, textile, rubber; peeling of the plating)

Any damage on any part of the watch resulting from abnormal/abusive use, lack of care, negligence, accidents (knocks dents, crushing, broken crystal, etc.)

 

 

What will we do with the funds we raise?

Once we've raised our goal, we will invest funds towards marketing and production in order to grow our audience. We will also be using the funds to develop relationships with nonprofit organizations that share our core values in wanting to make a difference.

 

If funded, how will we fulfill your orders?

We’ve made a few adjustments to our initial prototype, perfected our design, and selected a renowned manufacturer that is a leader in the industry. Once we receive your funds from Indiegogo, we will place the initial deposit to start mass production. Depending on the size of the order, production time will take roughly 30 days to complete. When our inventory arrives we will proceed to send TYMPCE’s to our amazing backers!

 

We need your support

With your support the opportunities are endless for our customers and us here at TYMPCE.  By backing TYMPCE and spreading the word to a friend or family member, you can help us achieve our goal of bettering the world of tomorrow. In order for us to achieve our goal, we will be bringing traffic to our page through the use of social media and digital marketing. We hope you see the same opportunities that TYMPCE has as we see; with your help TYMPCE will grow to its full potential. Thank you.

For our first collection, we are offering four different models to choose from.
 





 
Where is TYMPCE headed?
We want to launch multiple watch collections for both men and women, while maintaining quality at a competitive price.  Our aspirations for TYMPCE go beyond delivering premium quality at a fraction of the cost of what our competitors offer.  In pursuit of growing a collective of individuals who share the same goals of wanting to make a difference, TYMPCE strives to bridge the two worlds of fashion and social action.  In addition to our work in our local communities, we will be donating a portion of our profits to an array of nonprofit organizations that execute innovative methods in finding solutions in major issues throughout the world, beginning with addiction.

 
Watch Specifications:
Case Material:  316L Carbon Stainless Steel
Case Diameter: 41 mm
Band Material: 316L Carbon Stainless Steel/Leather
Band Width: 22 mm
Clasp: Push Button Deployment Clasp
Clasp Material: 316L Carbon Stainless Steel
Dial Window Material: Crystal Mineral Glass
Display: Analog
Movement: Japanese Quartz
Date Function: Yes
Water Resistant: 5 ATM
Warranty
We are so confident in our product that every TYMPCE watch includes a 2 year warranty with your purchase. If something were to happen to your TYMPCE within that time period, we hope you'll send it back to us.
Warranty does not cover:  
The life of the battery
Wear and tear and aging (e.g. scratched crystal; alteration of the color and/or material of non metallic straps and chains, such as leather, textile, rubber; peeling of the plating)
Any damage on any part of the watch resulting from abnormal/abusive use, lack of care, negligence, accidents (knocks dents, crushing, broken crystal, etc.)




 



 
What will we do with the funds we raise?
Once we've raised our goal, we will invest funds towards marketing and production in order to grow our audience. We will also be using the funds to develop relationships with nonprofit organizations that share our core values in wanting to make a difference.
 
If funded, how will we fulfill your orders?
We’ve made a few adjustments to our initial prototype, perfected our design, and selected a renowned manufacturer that is a leader in the industry. Once we receive your funds from Indiegogo, we will place the initial deposit to start mass production. Depending on the size of the order, production time will take roughly 30 days to complete. When our inventory arrives we will proceed to send TYMPCE’s to our amazing backers!
 
We need your support
With your support the opportunities are endless for our customers and us here at TYMPCE.  By backing TYMPCE and spreading the word to a friend or family member, you can help us achieve our goal of bettering the world of tomorrow. In order for us to achieve our goal, we will be bringing traffic to our page through the use of social media and digital marketing. We hope you see the same opportunities that TYMPCE has as we see; with your help TYMPCE will grow to its full potential. Thank you.

story:
Meet GENECIE - the 2-in-1 wallet and shopping bag

The average person uses over 400 plastic grocery bags a year.

We want to live fast and convenient. As a result, people have produced billions of tonnes plastic waste, 79% of which is in landfill and environment.

You may not see all that plastic around you, but you're eating it with seafood and drinking it with water - on average, 83% of water samples contain plastic fibers.

Sustainable lifestyle requires planning and change of habits. Think about it: taking a reusable bag to a shop sounds so easy, and yet we keep forgetting it at home.

 

We made a product that helps people become more planet-friendly without thinking much: a wallet with a built-in shopping tote. Its innovative addition? A slim side pocket that hides a spacious carry-all bag - just pull it out and use whenever you need it.

 

 
Now, there's really not much to remember - we simply don't go to a shop without money and credit cards. In a witty way, GENECIE helps anyone reduce their plastic bag use, easily and effortlessly.

We spent months designing and redesigning GENECIE to create a product that's elegant and sophisticated, while intuitive and convenient to use.

 

 

 

Made of soft faux leather and fine-tuned to details - from zippers to linings - GENECIE is made for contemporary women with dynamic lifestyles.

Even casually folded, the built-in shopping bag is invisible from the outside. In fact, you'll forget it's even there until you'll be at the counter, asked if you need a plastic bag.

 

 

 

The GENECIE wallet will be available in two colors - Midnight blue and Peach beige. With every wallet, you'll receive a minimal-cut tote bag in a color of your choice.

 

 

 

 

After spent a month traveling around Asia, Krista (one of the founders) came back broken-hearted - the plastic pollution she experienced there had left a lasting effect on her.

She started to rethink her habits and decided to cut down her own plastic use. Giving up plastic grocery bags sounded like an easy first step. Unfortunately, she continuously forgot her reusable tote at home and found herself in a shop with just a wallet in hand.

Until one time it hit her: the wallet! She never left home with it and it was always with her when she went shopping.

She started to look for a wallet that would also function as a shopping bag. Unable to find one, she and her business partner Ieva created GENECIE - a tasteful wallet with a built-in tote. And a revolutionary goal to reduce plastic waste.

 

We spent months developing the product and finding a reliable manufacturing partner. And now we're finally ready for production, which is where we need your help.

GENECIE is so close we can touch it - literally. Now, to make it available for everyone, we need your help to start the production.

We've done the time-consuming part - planning, research, and prototyping. We've found reliable a manufacturer that's ready to start the production as soon as we give them the green light. All parties are set and ready to go, which means quick and certain delivery after the campaign.

We're collaborating with suppliers and manufacturers with tens of years of experience in producing fashion accessories for international and local brands. They've been professional, attentive to detail, and punctual throughout our collaboration, and we rely on them.

However, there can always be obstacles and challenges we cannot foresee right now. We promise to keep our eyes open and our finger on the pulse, so we can keep you updated and let you follow the manufacturing process with us.

Other ways you can help (and we'll appreciate it as much as your pledge!)

  • Share this campaign on your social media.
  • Share it on online groups of like-minded people.
  • Tell your mom, friend and colleague about it.
  • Feature GENECIE on your blog.

DOWNLOAD OUR PRESS PACK

THANK YOU!

Krista & Ieva

story:
Help Us Rebuild Your Creative Outlet

On April 5th, 2018, we were among the millions of people who learned that Polyvore suddenly shut down with no warning leaving their dedicated and beautiful community without a home.

#BringBackPolyvore has become a movement and we have been personally touched by every story. This was more than a web destination for many users. It was a place for them to express their creativity and find like-minded people. They deserve a home and it has become our personal mission to make this happen for them.

But the realities involved with building some of these features will require a significant shift in our core business of Fashion.

This support will help us deliver features that are most missed but difficult to fund with our current business model.

* Ability to clip images from the web and bring them into ShopLook

* Ability to crop images within our editor

* Addition of text into our editor

* Group features such as groups and group messaging

* [TBD] We are also exploring a way to allow you to import in your old sets

In addition to building these features, some of these funds will be used to support the infrastructure costs that come with supporting them (storage, hosting costs, etc).  If we have learned anything from being in the world of tech, features are expensive to maintain and it is important that we plan properly to avoid being another source of disappointment.

The Impact

Be a part of an unprecedented movement and enable a global community of creators to get their home back.

Here is one of the many personal user stories of impact:

"These tools had helped me through depression, anxiety, and hard times by giving me a place to let my mind wander and be creative and artistic with no judgment or pressure."

Risks & Challenges

Although we are committed to delivering these features, there are always elements of unpredictability that come with a software development business.

We will work hard to deliver these features but for some, you may see minor adjustments as we dig into building them.

Additionally, developing these features, to the standard of this amazing community, will take time and may involve multiple iterations.

That said, it is our promise that we will not rest until this product can help this amazing community share the beauty of their work with the world.  We greatly appreciate everyone’s patience and understanding as we deliver on this mission :-)

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be in a position to contribute financially. There are many ways you can help:

Help bring awareness to this campaign

Sign up with ShopLook and use the current product (this will help us with other funding goals)

Share feedback and encouragement with us by following us on social media, mentioning us and reaching out

We look forward to rebuilding this community, together! Let's get it done :-)

story:
Hello, my name is Galina Prunier, very much a passionate New Yorker. Inspired by classic books and movies, from an era of characters dressed in vintage attire, and followed by numerous years within a contemporary fashion industry, I began to draw on ideas for beautifying the modern woman, a bridge of aesthetics between the then and now. As a result I launched Galamarr nearly two years ago, my own line of handcrafted hair-accessories and so much more. With the sole belief that regardless of living in the 21st Century – our lifestyle today having evolved in oh so many ways – a passion for us women feeling great about ourselves remains, and that each can look great every day and everywhere.


After the success of building up a clientele of happy customers with positive feedback, it is now time to take Galamarr to the next level, and for that I will need the financial support of contributors like yourself. Until now I have single-handedly created every item found on my website or by distributors, and am in the process of acquiring a staff of skilled workers right here in NYC to be trained in replicating my creations in order to meet demands. The products of Galamarr have very much to offer women, and its growth is essential although expensive.


I am here to raise 20K to take my dreams, efforts and my business to the next level. The most important factors of this drive are:

  1. Building a staff of three to five skilled workers right here in NYC to be trained in replicating my creations in order to meet demands, to administer and process orders, and a work space for the team.
  2. Purchasing materials, fabrics, dies and paints, tools (jewelry and other), machinery, etc. Sewing machines: $500 times five ($2500); fabrics (silks, linen, misc): $700; Swarovski crystals, rhinestones, etc: $800; dye and paints: $500.
  3. Participating at all "fashion accessories shows" locally and nationally, essential at getting Galamarr out there, to wholesalers, etc. These range between $5000 and above a weekend, plus travel expenses outside NYC.

Galamarr offers an array of perks for contributions to my campaign in donations from $100 to $500+, that of products within a certain value (please see above right).

I remain enthusiastic for this project, never walking away from a challenge, and am grateful for any of your help. However, if I were not to reach the amount necessary for my dream project, I will continue with any funds on hand and will diligently do my very best, because I am so determinate! This is my future and I hope it will come through with your generous contribution. 

What Galamarr thrives to influence is a certain aesthetic that allow women to explore possibilities with their hair, for their own vanity as well as accenting society to new exciting beliefs, never ignored by the men in their lives as well as all their folk, family and friends. I do believe Galamarr makes a serious contribution and enhances very positive moods in all of us. Time and time again I've seen non-believers transformed right before their eyes, never imagining what a simple touch of beauty could add to our everyday look. I do believe in Galamarr and many will attest to this passionate drive.

Of course there are obstacles that come with the terrain of funding a campaign such as this one, that of marketing my line of products alone is challengeable, yet not impossible with a skilled team, the Internet and supporters. Leveraging social media to continue building Galamarr's following proves to bring me other channels of distribution, ultimately creating a larger presence and the means of steering the drive.
 
I am very excited, working a lot, and now all I need to roll my business is your generous help!


My dear friends, ANY support will be welcome. If you can help with promoting this project, getting the word out and using Indiegogo share tools, I will be deeply obliged. 
 
Thank you, 
Galina

Galamarr.com

story:
What is LOGOS? 

We are a brand whose goal is to lead the fight in ending veteran homeless through long-term employment. A steady job and income helps provide a sense of purpose, self-worth and hope for future independence. The products we make provide these things, a positive work environment to our homeless veteran employees while teaching them skills to support their reintegration into the workforce.

According to the US Dept. of Housing and Urban Affairs: “On any given night, there are over 49,900 United States Veterans sleeping on the streets. Many have found themselves homeless due to the lingering effects of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substance abuse, which are compounded by a lack of family and social support networks. Additionally, military occupations and training are not always transferable to the civilian workforce, placing some veterans at a disadvantage when competing for employment”.

By supporting us, you’ll do more than get a great bag. You’ll be making a personal statement that you also support ending veterans’ homelessness in America.


Veterans carried us. Now it's our turn to carry those veterans who need our support.


How can I join LOGOS to make an impact?

Join us in the fight by pre ordering one of these awesome LOGOS bags made by a newly empowered, gainfully employed, homeless veterans. All of our bags are made from organic cotton and are meant to last with reinforced stitching for extra durability. Each bag is handcrafted in the USA by homeless veterans who take pride in their work and pay the utmost attention to detail.

We are partnering with local service organizations to recruit homeless veterans for employment and setting a new standard for treatment of the homeless by offering consistent wages of $15/hr and benefits like vacation, sick days, insurance and reimbursement for public transportation. 


The LOGOS Collection



Fanny Pack - This is our version of the most underrated fashion accessory of all-time. 

  • Made of 12 oz. organic canvas and cotton webbing
  • YKK zippers
  • Dual zippered compartments: Large front pocket and smaller rear pocket.
  • Made in the U.S.A. by homeless veterans
  • Measures; 6" tall x 12" wide x 3" long

Tote Bag - This versatile tote bag is perfect for anyone, anytime. 

  • Made of 12 oz. organic canvas and cotton webbing
  • 3-snap closure
  • Internal pocket divides storage
  • Reinforced stitching for improved durability
  • Made in the U.S.A. by homeless veterans
  • 16" tall x 14" wide x 5" long

Duffel Bag - This is “the greatest gym bag ever created” as stated by us, but we think you’ll agree.


  • Made of 12 oz. organic canvas and cotton webbing
  • YKK zipper
  • Adjustable and removable shoulder strap
  • 4 external pockets for keeping small items handy
  • Reinforced stitching for improved durability
  • Made in the U.S.A. by homeless veterans
  • 8" tall x 20" wide x 8" long

Rucksack - The U.S. military rucksacks uses rucksacks because they are awesome. Our version is awesome too. 


  • Made of 12 oz. organic canvas and cotton webbing
  • Internal pocket with YKK zipper
  • 3-snap closure
  • Adjustable top closure strap
  • Adjustable shoulder straps
  • Reinforced stitching for improved durability
  • Made in the U.S.A. by homeless veterans
  • 22" tall x 14" wide x 7" long


Rewards


Budget

This is the breakdown of costs for our $30,000 goal:


Timeline

This idea was born in 2014 when we decided to fight veteran homelessness through by providing homeless veterans with long-term employment.

Production will begin in late-January of 2016 and we hope to have all perks delivered by the summer of 2016. Everyone who supports our campaign will receive an e-thank you and a certificate to give as a gift for the holidays.

After we raise $30,000, our goal is to reinvest some of these funds into making our business more sustainable and thus hire more homeless veterans. Any extra pair of hands we can employ to produce these bags is one homeless veteran less in the street.

Currently our start-up timeline looks like this:


More about LOGOS


PRODUCTS WITH MEANING

Our name: Logos is Greek for “meaning” which is referenced in Viktor Frankl’s famous book Man’s Search for Meaning. The term lends itself to logotherapy, which is a psychological theory developed by Dr. Frankl. In this book, he writes “logotherapy focuses on the meaning of human existence as well as on man’s search for such a meaning” and that this search for meaning “is the primary motivational force in man.” The ideas of logotherapy inspired not only the name of our company, but the entire premise of our operations. We aim to provide a work environment that allows each employee to find meaning in his or her life.

Our mission (again): To create high-quality products made by homeless veterans in a positive work environment.

Our vision: To lead the fight towards ending veteran homelessness through long-term employment.

Our values: People, our planet, transparency and growth:

  • People: Take care of our employees by creating a positive and supportive workplace.
  • Planet: Maximize sustainability whenever possible.
  • Transparency: so that our supporters know they follow our operations and the impact we’re having on veteran homelessness. We don’t want to be another brand who claims to make a difference. We will make a difference and think it’s everyone's right to see proof.
  • Growth: Use profits to help grow, which will increase the impact we have fighting veteran homelessness.

Our Team:

Justin Groza, Founder. A 10-year U.S. Army veteran, which is where he developed an interest in helping veterans. A graduate of Baldwin-Wallace University ('04) he served two tours in Afghanistan with the Army and one as a DoD civilian employee. While earning his MBA at Corvinus University of Budapest he developed and refined the concept for Logos. After graduating, he moved to Los Angeles to join the fight against veteran homelessness (in a sustainable way).


Cici Ly, Designer. Born in Cambodia but raised in Seattle, Washington. She’s been working in the creative realm for most of her life, splitting time as an artist and designer at some of the biggest brands in America. She is also an advocate for nature, animals, and social justice for everyone.


Our Partners:

LOGOS will seek out employees from the following organizations who provide care to homeless veterans in the Greater Los Angeles area.


West Los Angeles Veterans Health Administration (VA)


The Salvation Army’s – The Haven

Risks and Challenges

Helping people reintegrate into the workforce isn’t easy. It takes time, patience, understanding and compassion. Each employee is a different person with different needs. Thankfully these are skills our team has acquired through their past experiences in the military and fashion industry and we feel fully prepared to take on any challenge that may arise.

You might also, be wondering what we will do if we don’t meet our goal. Well, (obviously) we hope this won’t happen, but if it does, we will move forward with our plan and hire as many homeless veterans as possible to fulfill the demand from our campaign. In this case, production may be slower than anticipated but we will still be employing homeless veterans to make great products for all of our supporters.


Other Ways to Make a Difference

Please, tell your friends about us and share our campaign on social media! Social media is the fuel for our fundraising engine. By promoting our cause you will allow us to reach thousands of people we couldn’t reach on our own. Sharing our campaign will get us closer to reaching our goal and make it possible to start our work supporting homeless veterans.

Just copy and paste something like this to your Facebook or Twitter:

"I support #Logosproducts, a new brand employing homeless #veterans. Check out their bags and support the cause! http://bit.ly/1jW5JWa"
