story:
Veza is a unique line of 12 fashion and sport wristbands. We have taken the traditional plastic wristband and given it an upgrade, both in the look and the charitable aspect. The Veza wristband has a leathery feel, an embossed Veza logo and an innovative design. And the Veza wristband is the first of its kind with a seamless lip that gracefully sits on your wrist.

Veza wristbands are stylish, sporty and fun for men, women and teens. Each Veza color is partnered with a different world-renowned charity organization (see all wristbands & their partnered charities below). Your support helps build awareness for the charity and provides a portion of proceeds to the cause. Wear the color you like, or support the cause you feel connected to.

CHARITIES:

Each wristband color supports a different charity. When you wear the wristband of the charity you support, not only are you wearing a stylish bracelet but you are also helping build awareness for the cause.

Below are the 12 Veza wristband colors and the charities that are supported by each wristband:

CHOOSE A COLOR. CHOOSE A CAUSE.

Each Veza wristband color is partnered with a different cause. No two causes are the same and each partnership directly impacts people in need throughout the United States and Worldwide.

You as the shopper can choose either the wristband color you like, or the cause that you want to help support. With a variety of causes to choose from -- like hunger, orphans, crisis aid, and more -- the choice is yours. And you get to show your support in fashionable and fun way.

MEET THE FOUNDER.

Teenage Entrepreneur and incoming College Freshman, Brandon Michaels, was always on the lookout for cool accessories, wristbands, and the newest trends. When he couldn't find something that incorporated style and philanthropy, he decided to create his own.

The wristbands on the market lacked design and innovation and that was where Brandon began. He started working with a product designer to help him put his ideas out on paper. He wanted to create something clean, simple, elegant but also wanted to add an element of philanthropy and offer people a way to fashionably support a cause.

Brandon created a wristband that matches every style, personality and occasion. The Veza wristband is an accessory for both men and women and the stylish look can fit a casual or formal look.

When the design was set, Brandon got started contacting charities. But rather than choosing one charity, as other brands do, Brandon chose to partner each of the 12 wristband colors with a different charity organization.

PRODUCT INFORMATION.

The Veza wristband is made for Men, Women and Teens of all ages. There are three sizes, as listed below.

  • Small: 6.9 inch 
  • Medium: 7.5 inch 
  • Large: 8.1 inch

Veza Wristbands are:

  • Great for ages 3 and up 
  • Packaging is made of 100% recycled paper 
  • Made of non-toxic, medical grade plastic 
  • Designed in California 
  • Waterproof 

Each unique Veza wristband is made from the highest quality materials. Available in three sizes, its stretch feature allows it to slide down the hand and lay comfortably around the wrist for a stylish elegance. This fashionable wristband complements any occasion, including work, school, play or formal. The sport Veza wristband features an embossed Veza logo and the design of its perforation has the trendy look of distressed leather.

VEZA IN ACTION.

VEZA SUPPORTERS.

AS SEEN IN.

story:
HELLO!

I apologise for the cheesy video but hopefully it will tell you a bit about how this whole business began as Scarletts Vintage Attire (now Oh So Scarletts) over 4 years ago. I am 21 years old and live in Cornwall,  anyone who has ever been to cornwall will know it's very quiet and thus small businesses struggle, so here is the plan. I am moving to Brighton! My campaign is to ask all you lovely people to help us make the big move and open a fabulous handmade clothing shop were customers can walk in and see clothing made before their very eyes. If my funding is completed then I will be able to rent a shop for 3 months, kit it out and start my dream of making pretty things for a living.

The £20,000 sounds like a lot and it honestly is and it's impossible to get that sort of money without selling a kidney on ebay. The money will cover 3 months rent in Brighton with a little extra to buy rails, decoration and flyers for promotion so we can continue to grow after this venture. By investing in this you will get to watch the transition take place, receive a handmade headscarf and an invitation to the launch event where I can personally thankyou for all your support! 
If we do not reach the entire goal the money will be saved up for the day when we can afford the move so it will go towards a shop as I am determined to make this happen! However if we only get £100 we would put it towards advertising in the hope that sales will drive us closer to the dream.

It's important to support independent business because each one has something unique and special to give, with everything being handmade every item we make is unique and with the ability for people to watch this process while shopping, is rare!
In previous years I have travelled to London and back in a day to sell in the big city and I have always made profit at these events however with a part time job to support myself I have been unable to gather enough money at one off events to really make the business thrive. If I get the right money I will be able to open a shop and support myself on wages as the business begins to fully fund itself.

With every venture there are risks, and uprooting my life to open a shop is a mighty big risk however after 4 years I am ready. Being a manager in a store for others I have the ability to promote and push the business enough to make the move permanent and the business thrive enabling it to fund itself and then me.
I have accommodation for the months I will be in shop until I am satisfied with the growth of the business and the determination to make it happen.


If you are as excited as I am for this venture please donate as much as you can, however if you are unable to donate it doesn't mean you can't help Oh So Scarletts grow, share this campaign,  get tweeting, make some noise and like our social pages! Even talking can set the ball in motion! 


Thank you again everyone And please follow us

www.Facebook.com/scarlettsva

www.Facebook.com/ohsoscarletts

www.scarlettsvintageattire.co.uk

www.twitter.com/ohsoscarletts

story:
Introduction

Since the foundation of our label H O W L by Maria Glück in 2013, our collections and designs are driven by the idea to bring ethical and sustainable fashion not just  into magazines and fashion weeks, but into our wardrobes.

We love fashion and we love people, and this is exactly why we believe the production process to be as important as any other side of the fashion industry. Incidents like in Rana Plaza are only the peak of the iceberg. While fast fashion in the sphere of production proves to be unsustainable, in the sphere of consumption it leaves us with meaningless and repetitive commodities. Fashion garments no longer have a value based on the design, the craft, the fabric quality or the producers' work. 

For us, employing sustainable, organic, ethical, recycled and waste reducing sources in the production is essential. It is part of how we want to live. It's our lifestyle. We are very excited to see our movement growing. More and more conscious and reflected people are looking for a big change in fashion. 

Some of our designs are intended for fashion runways, shows or photos. However, our passion and aim are to create for people who simply love and wear our clothes. This is why we want to get closer with you. Learn how we work, and tell us what you love. Let’s work together on the future of fashion. Now.



What is H O W L  by Maria Glück?

Maria Glück founded the Berlin based label H O W L in 2013.

H O W L  by Maria Glück creates sustainable high end fashion for men, women and unisex with a minimal style.

Our production is local and regional (Berlin-area and various regions of Spain) and sustainable, respecting all social standards and labor rights.

H O W L by Maria Glück has been featured by fashion magazines like VOGUE, Factice, OZON, FuckingYoung, Protein, Eluxe, Chasseur or Œ Magazine.

H O W L by Maria Glück has presented collections in Berlin Fashion Week (SS 14), Mercedes Benz Fashion Week Madrid (FW 14), Paris Fashion Week, London Fashion Week (FW15) and Fashionclash. In 2014, Maria Glück was a finalist of The Future Of Fashion program organized by Not Just A Label and Who's Next Paris. In September 2014, she was featured as one of the 200 world’s top talents byVogue Italia. In February 2015, Maria Glück took part in the International Fashion Showcase at London Fashion Week organized by the British Fashion Council.


 What is our next challenge?

We are looking forward to designing the SS 16 collection with much excitement. We plan to explore historical weaving looms in rural Spain where local artisans still handcraft beautiful woven fabrics employing old techniques. In cooperation with them, we will create beautiful patterns and unique textiles.

By doing so, we prevent the loss of these traditions and we support local and peripheral economies. For us, that’s not just a matter of respect. We actually enjoy the social, cultural and artistic challenges coming with the encounter, and we incorporate those challenges in our designs.

We will regularly update our findings and the development of our sourcing on our blog. Our Spring/Summer 16 collection will be finally presented in September or October 2015 in the frame of an international fashion week.




Why do we need your help?

As much as we love to put all our efforts into the research of sourcing, into a reflected design or a sustainable production – it all creates high costs. Product research, traveling to find traditional and sustainable producers, prototyping, samples, colors, lookbooks, photo shootings, web design, showroom, and collection's presentation.

That’s why we decided to reach out for your help, so that we can continue to go further and make sustainability in fashion real. 

You could support this crowdfunding campaign for our collection's project. We aim to raise $ 10,000 to support the funding. We offer exciting and exclusive rewards in exchange for your support. Donate, spread the word, connect, and join in! We also welcome any ethical and sustainable sponsor.


REWARDS:

Limited edition Spring/Summer 16 collection - P O S T C A R D

(will be delivered upon presentation of SS 16 collection in September/October)


Limited edition Spring/Summer 16 collection - P O S T E R

(will be delivered upon presentation of SS 16 collection in September/October)


Y O U R  N A M E  in one of our D E S I G N S


F o r e s t   P r i n t  B a g 
Image work and photography by designer Maria Glück featuring the Harz mountains and forest in Germany.


R e c  y c l e d  F i b e r  S p o r t  D r e s s   w i t h  w o o d e n  l e t t e r s
sizes: S, M, L  Recycled polyester from PET plastic bottles.


O r g a n i c  C o t t o n  S w e a t e r  w i t h  w o o d e n  l e t t e r s
size: S, M, L


%  u p  to  4  s e a s o n s  d i s c o u n t


Become one of us!

M e m b e r  +  B a c k s t a g e  p a s s  +  F r o n t  r o w  invitation to our collection presentation



WE
HAVE
A PASSION
AND
WE
HAVE
A DREAM.

Contribute and create with us a new vision of fashion, a conscious lifestyle, a new way of approaching the world. 

Become a pioneer.

Let's build the future of sustainable fashion.

Together.

NOW!


More about us:

Website: www.howlhowlhowl.com
Instagram: instagram.com/mariagluck
Facebook: facebook.com/howlbymariagluck
Twitter: twitter.com/HOWLmariagluck

Blog: twitter.com/HOWLmariagluck

Email: info@howlhowlhowl.com

T H A N K   Y  O  U  ! ! !
story_txt:
Introduction 
Since the foundation of our label H O W L by Maria Glück in 2013, our
      collections
      and designs are driven by the idea to bring ethical and sustainable      fashion not just  into
      magazines and fashion weeks, but into
      our wardrobes.
      
We love fashion and we love people, and this is exactly why we believe the production process to
        be as
        important as any other side of the fashion industry. Incidents like in Rana Plaza are only the peak of the iceberg. While fast fashion in the sphere of production proves to be unsustainable, in the sphere of consumption it leaves us with meaningless and repetitive commodities. Fashion garments no longer have a value based on the design, the craft, the fabric quality or the producers' work.  
For us, employing sustainable, organic, ethical,
          recycled and
          waste reducing sources in the production is essential. It is part of
        how we want to live. It's our lifestyle. 
We
are very excited to see our movement growing. More and more conscious
and reflected people are looking for a big change in fashion. 
Some of our designs are intended for fashion runways, shows
      or photos. However, our passion and aim are to create for people
      who simply love
      and wear our clothes. This is why we want to get closer with you. Learn how we work, and
      tell us what
      you love. Let’s work together on the future of fashion. Now.





What is H O W L  by Maria Glück?

Maria Glück founded the Berlin based label
        H O W L in 2013. 
      
H O W L  by Maria Glück creates sustainable high end fashion
        for men, women
        and unisex with a minimal style. 
      
      
Our production is local and regional 
(Berlin-area
and various regions of
Spain) and sustainable, respecting all social standards and labor rights.
H O W L by Maria Glück has been featured by fashion magazines like VOGUE, Factice, OZON, FuckingYoung,
      Protein, Eluxe, Chasseur or Œ Magazine.
H O W L by Maria Glück has presented collections in Berlin
          Fashion Week        (SS 14), Mercedes Benz Fashion Week Madrid (FW 14), Paris Fashion Week, London Fashion Week (FW15) and Fashionclash.
        In 2014, Maria Glück was a finalist of The Future Of Fashion
        program organized
        by Not Just A Label and Who's Next Paris. In
        September 2014, she was featured as one of the 200 world’s top talents
        byVogue Italia.
      
        In February 2015, Maria Glück took part in the International
          Fashion Showcase at London Fashion Week organized by the British Fashion Council.




What is
our next challenge?

We
are looking forward to designing the SS 16 collection with much
excitement. We plan to explore historical weaving looms in rural Spain where local artisans
still handcraft beautiful
woven fabrics employing old techniques. In cooperation with them, we will create beautiful patterns and unique  textiles. 

By doing so, we prevent the loss of these traditions and we support local and peripheral economies. For us,
that’s not just a matter of respect. We actually enjoy the social, cultural and
artistic challenges coming with the encounter, and
we incorporate those challenges in our designs.

We will regularly update our findings and the development of our sourcing on our blog. Our Spring/Summer 16 collection will be finally presented in September or October 2015 in the frame of an international fashion week.









Why do we need your help?
As much as we love to put all our efforts into the research of sourcing, into a reflected
design or a sustainable production – it all creates high costs. Product research, traveling
to find traditional and sustainable producers, prototyping, samples, colors,
lookbooks, photo shootings, web design, showroom, and collection's presentation. 
That’s why we decided to reach out for your help, so that we can continue to
go further and make sustainability in fashion real. 



You could support this crowdfunding campaign for our collection's project.
 We aim to raise $ 10,000 to support the funding. We offer exciting and 
exclusive rewards in exchange for your support. Donate, spread the word,
 connect, and join in! We also welcome any ethical and sustainable 
sponsor. 




REWARDS:
Limited edition Spring/Summer 16 collection - P O S T C A R D

(will be delivered upon presentation of SS 16 collection in September/October)
Limited edition Spring/Summer 16 collection - P O S T E R
 
(will be delivered upon presentation of SS 16 collection in September/October)


Y O U R  N A M E  in one of our D E S I G N S



 F o r e s t   P r i n t  B a g  Image work and photography by designer Maria Glück featuring the Harz mountains and forest in Germany.



R e c  y c l e d  F i b e r  S p o r t  D r e s s   w i t h  w o o d e n  l e t t e r ssizes: S, M, L  Recycled polyester from PET plastic bottles.
O r g a n i c  C o t t o n  S w e a t e r   w i t h  w o o d e n  l e t t e r s size: S, M, L


%  u p  to  4  s e a s o n s  d i s c o u n t 


Become one of us! 
M e m b e r  +  B a c k s t a g e  p a s s  +  F r o n t  r o w  invitation to our collection presentation




  





WE HAVE A PASSION AND WE HAVE A DREAM.

Contribute and create with us a new vision of fashion, a
conscious lifestyle, a new way of approaching the world. 

Become a pioneer.
Let's build the future of sustainable fashion. 
Together.
NOW!

More about us:

Website:
        www.howlhowlhowl.comInstagram: instagram.com/mariagluck
      Facebook: facebook.com/howlbymariagluck
      Twitter: twitter.com/HOWLmariagluck
Blog: twitter.com/HOWLmariagluck
Email: info@howlhowlhowl.comT H A N K   Y  O  U  ! ! !

story:
The Reason

 Every 3 minutes, someone is diagnosed with blood cancer.  Every 10 minutes someone loses that battle.  But research funded by the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society (LLS) and others is offering promise that these diseases can be cured once and for all. 

     
  • I am Greg Blake and, working alongside my colleagues from WMS Partners and several good friends, we are raising as much money as we possibly can for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society by June 5th.   
  • We are doing this on behalf of an amazing kid, Mikey Thurin.  Mikey was diagnosed at age 4 and has been in a battle with Leukemia ever since -- he is now 11.  He has struggled physically, emotionally, and socially as a result of his disease.  Mikey wants to do whatever he can to help raise awareness and money to help other children live longer, better lives.
  • Instead of simply asking our friends for donations, a close friend Rocky Parrish (Founder of RockDeep Athletic Wear) has generously offered to donate, at cost, an amazing pair of shoes that he is custom-making for this fundraising campaign. 
    •  

What We Need & What You Get

 Yes, that's right.  Instead of just sending us $100 to help Mikey and other kids battling Leukemia and Lymphoma -- we are creating the opportunity for you to buy the coolest shoe you have ever owned with 100% of the proceeds above the cost of production and shipping going to fund pediatric blood cancer research through the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society (LLS).  
  • We already have the cost per shoe down to $25 if we can sell 1,500 pairs and are working to get it down to $20 or lower by selling significantly more than that.  So, somewhere between $75-80+ of your $100 goes directly to LLS to help Mikey and other kids who in the fight with blood cancers.
  • The more shoes we make, the lower our manufacturing and shipping costs become.  So, making or exceeding our goal only increases the portion of your donation that will go to LLS.  So, please spread the word!
  • Upon your donation, you will receive a thank you and receipt directly from the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society for tax purposes.

The Impact

The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society funds research across the continuum, from basic research through clinical trials, from bench to bedside.

  • To date, LLS has  invested more than $1 billion in research to advance therapies and save lives. LLS research grants have funded many of today's most promising advances, including targeted therapies and immunotherapies and some of the therapies first approved for blood cancer patients are now helping patients with other types of cancers and other serious diseases.
  • Thanks to research and access to better treatments, survival rates for many blood cancer patients have doubled, tripled and even quadrupled since 1960.
  • To learn more about the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, the impact they're making, and the current state of affairs related to the fight against blood cancer, please visit LLS Website .


Risks & Challenges

 The biggest risk to this effort is that we don't sell enough shoes to achieve the economies of scale needed to achieve our cost targets.  Regardless, 100% of your $100 donation not spent on making/shipping shoes to you will be donated.  Absolute worst case is $75/shoe.  Here is how we will be dealing with that challenge:

  • The first way we are addressing this challenge is by having the coolest shoe design you have ever seen, with a quality sneaker for  less than you would pay at a store -- AND raise  $$ at the same time.  This is really a no-brainer.
  • We have lined up numerous (i friends and other outlets to get the word out and sell the shoes.  Everyone has been incredibly supportive and helpful and we are humbled and appreciative.


Other Ways You Can Help

 

I can't imagine why, but if for some reason you don't want to buy a great pair of shoes, for a reasonable cost, and help kids like Mikey with blood cancer, then please help get the word out to your network.    

Indiegogo has great tools to share this opportunity with the world -- please share away!!

story:
The starting mission of Dashing Outfitters is to provide an approachable and polished retail experience featuring unique, dynamic brands and boutiques with similar styles and missions.

This campaign is to fund the initial start-up costs of Dashing Outfitters and its first product line. The first product line will be bowties, handmade in Tennessee. Within the following year, we will expand product lines to include other brands and other Dashing branded products. 

For now, Dashing Outfitters will primarily operate as an online store. It is an intermediate-term goal to have pop-up/temporary shops. 

A key mission of Dashing Outfitters is to have a portion of proceeds from sales to go to support programs that provide clothing to those in need, utilizing apparel as a means to success, educational opportunities, and career development.

story:
Short Summary

QUESTION: How do you provide thousands of jobs of all types? Affordable, low cost housing for tens of thousands of residents, generate no energy bills, create a cleaner environment, and get paid to do it!?!?

ANSWER: It begins with the Deep Green Tech Accelerator.

The things that cause high electric, water, and gas prices at home also impact your health and lifestyle.

The Deep Green Tech Accelerator will improve the performance and availability of energy independent solutions, buildings, and products by providing facilities and programs that allow residents to interact, learn, and innovate alongside the Corporate, Government, Academic organizations, and Utility Providers.

Tom Bray and Jim Schemmel began working together in 2004 to develop the greenest community in America.  Before Tom passed, his sons Matt and Marcus joined the team to add new focus and their business, marketing and finance backgrounds.

What We Need & What You Get

Jobs, careers, entrepreneurial opportunities and Homes are created when we move to energy independent solutions and build or update buildings and housing with layouts and designs that use their current environment to its benefit and include affordable smart technology that is available to everyone.

A ‘Living Laboratory’ community will be built first as part of the Deep Green Tech Accelerator, then duplicated with lower costs in other cities and states. 

The energy saved will be in such great quantities in each community that you can sell some of it back to your utility provider, and you will receive an energy check instead of a bill each month.

What the campaign will cover:

AMOUNT

ITEM DESCRIPTION

$100,000

Form Team: Lead Project Manager, Forestry Manager, Head Engineering, IT and Tech Accelerator Manager

$50,000

Crowd Funding Costs: (3%/9%), plus rewards ($2-$5K)

$100,000

Business Operations: Legal, Accounting, Infrastructure, Technology, etc.

Development Operations:

$50,000

  Refinement of Master Plan

$200,000

  Complete Accelerator Facilities, Launch 'Accelerator Projects'

$500,000

TOTAL

Unique Perks:

Receive a personal Thank You on a special recycled book mark with ‘Advice from a tree’!

Trees, Groves, and Forests planted in your honor by the Deep Green Tech Accelerator!

Eco-Friendly, The Deep Green Tech Accelerator Tumbler, Bag and T-Shirts!

A Brick or ‘Platinum’ Brick in the Founders Wall or Walkway at the Deep Green Tech Accelerator!

Have a building named in your honor!

If we do not make our goal, funds will still go to the development of the Deep Green Tech Accelerator and other educational programs.

The Impact

Help us build the first Deep Green Tech Accelerator and the model for creating jobs, and low cost affordable smart housing, with no energy bills. 

So that we can all have a cleaner environment and get paid doing it in the ‘living laboratory’ and in your community.

Risks & Challenges

We have a developed plan, Corporate, Government, Academic organizations and Utility Providers ready to go.  But, when the financial crisis hit in 2008 operations were put on hold, until recently. 

We now have a location that has the diversity of terrain needed to test many different solutions and methods required to reduce costs as much as possible and it is conveniently located by many of the resources needed. 

Now is the time, and the team is ready to go again with your help and support.

  • We will share regular updates on the progress of the Deep Green Tech Accelerator.
  • Some perks will include 'interactive membership' on planning for Tech Accelerator projects.

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't contribute, that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Like our Facebook Page, follow us on Twitter, and YouTube @The Deep Green Tech Accelerator
  • Check out our website at www.thewaldenreserve.com
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!

story:
ÜRBWA

What is ÜRBWA??

ÜRBWA produces unique fashion accessories for men made with high-end wood offering a refined style. We have a unique approach by having backgrounds in wood working, product design, tech and marketing. This perfect synergy allows for the creation and distribution of high quality and fashionable pieces; always ahead of the curve.

Why Indiegogo:

We have already succeeded in designing and creating the best looking wooden bowties on the market. FACT. We are now ready to take our company to the next level by investing in a new machine which will cut and engrave our bowties. This new machine will enable us to ramp up production and offer our bowties at a competitive price point while ensuring quick delivery. We aim for a perfect balance of consistency, availability, and pricing.

So what about sustainability?!

Just like you we care about trees, that’s why we only use leftover wood that would otherwise be thrown away. Our goal is to setup tree planting initiatives and give back to the environment. We are already in discussion with potential partners and know that, together, we can run a truly sustainable business.

                       “Find your style and stand out from the crowd”

* Can't wait to get this bow tie? Click on the premium box on your right! 


You like the Funky models!? Click on the Funky box to get yours!

                            It's time to step up your style! Go formal!

       Step it up a notch by clicking on the Classic Box!

               Not sure yet but you want to help an entrepreneur!?
         Click on the box "Be A Part Of The Journey" to help us!

Letter From The CEO

Hi, I’m Nick. I’m the CEO and Founder of URBWA.

I just wanted to say a few words before diving into the nitty-gritty.  Just like most of you, I have a dream to be part of something worthwhile and help others do the same. There’s a quote that says: “An entrepreneur is someone who jumps off a cliff and builds an airplane on the way down.” One year ago, I did just that. Reading a fashion article after exploring Seoul inspired me to dig deeper into mixing the vintage yet classy aspect of wood and bring it back into the spotlight.

We have a busy day-to-day life and offering a certain nostalgia by bringing back something tangible like wood, offering confidence and quality while indirectly connecting to the beauty of nature leads to the perfect accessory for ambitious men. I won't lie and say that this won’t be an electrifying experience, but my childhood dream and a strong team will guarantee success in this project. I have worked hard for the past years, sacrificing a lot to bring me to this point. 

So please, be my passenger in this adventure. Everyone can be an entrepreneur and work towards achieving their goal. Just jump!

Cheers,

 Nicolas Gouin Fontaine


How it will get done

Process process process. The machine will be versatile, customizable and already offer intricate engraving possibilities along with being extendable for when our product line grows. The advantage is no matter the amount raised, the products will be shipped out. The machine will allow us to simply ramp up production, 100 bowties / hour or 60 if engraved.  Once the remaining products ship, we will be able to hire more designers to offer more intricate designs and a fuller product line in the near future.

Our Team

We might be slightly biased, but we believe we are the best team in the world for what we have to offer. We love what we do and as important, we have fun! We know how to work together.. from business and tech experts, to world travellers, creative writers and marketers, our combined knowledge and years of experience is hard to beat. Most importantly, our PASSION for fashion and pushing the limits leads to a team than can both dream and execute. 

Mission

We are thriving to help young male professionals stand out from the crowd by offering accessories that will enhance their personal style adding a je-ne-sais-quoi to their outfit, and by extension, an extra spring in their step. The devil is in the details and it’s amazing how a little wink can make someones day. Believe in yourself!

Vision

We’re on on way to becoming the reference for accessories made out of premium wood for men. What Apple did for tech, we will do for fashion.

Values

We have 6 values that are primordial to the core of our business:


•  Excellence: We are perfectionists in general and thankfully that goes for our product and customer experience mindset as well. The drive to push ourselves to be better business owners and people is fundamental to our teams core.

•  Dedication: When the going gets tough, the tough get going. This is not a business, it is a calling we dedicate to our clients and demonstrate that through a rigorous work ethic, anything is possible. 

•  Detail Oriented; We believe what makes brands stand out is their level of detail. We go the extra step so you go the extra mile. Work hard, work smart.

•  Creativity: We are getting more and more busy so it's important to make moments for inspiration. This is more than a fashion statement, it is personalization that lets you show off your originality in different ways.

•  Sustainability: It is important to give back to the community, and to do so by giving back to the environment. We reuse and recycle and partner with pioneers in the tree planting industry since we realize that this is a limited resource. 

•  Ambition: We want to go far and help you do the same. The more we grow, the more we will fight to help you be the best version of yourself.

shipped out. The machine will allow us to simply ramp up production, 100
bowties / hour or 60 if engraved. 
Once
the remaining products ship, we will be able to hire more designers to offer
more intricate designs and a fuller product line in the near future.
Our Team
We
might be slightly biased, but we believe we are the best team in the world for
what we have to offer. We love
what we do and as important, we have fun! We know how to work together.. from
business and tech experts, to world travellers, creative writers and
marketers, our combined knowledge and years of experience is hard to beat. Most
importantly, our PASSION for fashion and pushing the limits leads to a team
than can both dream and execute. 

Mission


We are thriving to help young male professionals stand out from the crowd by offering accessories that will enhance their personal style adding a je-ne-sais-quoi to their outfit, and by extension, an extra spring in their step. The devil is in the details and it’s amazing how a little wink can make someones day. Believe in yourself!

Vision

We’re
on on way to becoming the reference for accessories made out of premium wood
for men. What Apple did for tech, we will do for fashion.
Values

We
have 6 values that are primordial to the core of our business:



• 
Excellence: We are perfectionists in general and
thankfully that goes for our product and customer experience mindset as well.
The drive to push ourselves to be better business owners and people is
fundamental to our teams core. 


• 
Dedication:
When the going gets tough, the tough get going. This is not a business, it is a calling we dedicate to our clients and demonstrate that through a
rigorous work ethic, anything is possible. 

• 
Detail
Oriented; We believe what makes brands stand out is their level of detail. We
go the extra step so you go the extra mile. Work hard, work smart.


• 
Creativity:
We are getting more and more busy so it's important to make moments for inspiration. This is more than a fashion statement, it is personalization that
lets you show off your originality in different ways.


• 
Sustainability:
It is important to give back to the community, and to do so by giving back to
the environment. We reuse and recycle and partner with pioneers in the tree
planting industry since we realize that this is a limited resource.  


• 
Ambition:
We want to go far and help you do the same. The more we grow, the more we will
fight to help you be the best version of yourself.

story:
We all need wood! TEATIAMO® designs wood for your pleasure!

TEATIAMO® was recently born out of my urge to design something timeless and beautiful for bedroom. "In my opinion sex should be elegant, fun and sensual and you shouldn’t hide it behind closed doors. You should praise it" says Tea Latvala, the designer and CEO of the brand. 

"TEATIAMO is a startup. I am so honoured that Indiegogo accepted my campaign after some struggles with other crowdfunding platforms. Yes it is a sex toy but it is so much more than that. I am designing something elegant and beautiful. I am trying to break the tabu of sex toys and bring sex industry and design industry closer together. My ultimate goal is make a living with TEATIAMO."

TEATIAMO® makes organic wood designs for pleasure to break the gap between sex and design industry. Wooden designs are designed with a mission: sex is a beautiful and aesthetic part of our lives. Not something dark or dirty. It’s fun and straightforward. This picture under was taken in a gallery in Miami Midtown - Gallery by Formato. The design is so timeless and chic that you can place it anywhere in your apartment.

How will I use the funds?

6900 USD will go straight to production costs of designs: 40 pieces of Rosewood, 20 pieces of Wenge, 20 pieces of Ash Tree and 20 pieces of Rubber Tree including the costs for TEATIAMO condoms.

10000 USD will go to further marketing of TEATIAMO in US market using the publicist and social media experts. It will also be used to carry through the travelling costs and logistics.

Every single piece is handcrafted and finished with paraffin wax or organic varnish depending on a wood quality making it one and only ecological choice for your pleasure. All pieces are unique and handmade in Finland Scandinavia. Well kept the pieces last a lifetime. Also no STDs!

TEATIAMO® thrives every woman’s and man’s right to open about sex and their sexuality. It overrules prejudices, fears and restraining roles. Here under is few layouts from K-oodi Magazine Editorial and interview. You can read the whole story from this link: KOODI MAGAZINE INTERVIEW 

"I wanted to design something beautiful that you could actually leave on the table or anywhere in the apartment without being worried that someone might see it." says Tea.

"I was born and raised in Finland so i get my inspiration from Finnish and Scandinavian nature. The wood qualities come from all over the world making it international and approachable. Every wood has its own spirit. The specific design of a banana shape demands a very skilled craftsman to process it. It might look very simple but there are hours and hours of work behind every piece."

All great things in life demand hard work, last a lifetime and come in beautiful packages. Please choose wood!

Pleasure in doing business with you,

Tea Latvala

story:
My name is Leah Garner and I am starting a new fashion subscription service called Cubicle Queen. Cubicle Queen inspires women to bring out your own personal brand in the outfits you wear to work every day. We do this by offering a subscription to borrow clothing that is tailored to your own style and dress code for work. You have the option of choosing to borrow complete outfits, a variety of pieces, or accessories alone. You pay an affordable fee per box and are able to wear the items that are shipped to you as many times as you want. Once you are ready for more variety in your wardrobe, send the items back in the easy pre-paid mailer bag and your next box will be on its way! The clothing you put on each morning should make a statement and match the confidence that you feel inside, and Cubicle Queen is an easy way to increase the depth of your own closet.

I have loved fashion my whole life and nothing has changed with my current job at an advertising agency in Houston. I have found my love for the business casual world of pencil skirts, blazers and pumps. I have so much fun getting dressed for work and I feel my confidence soar every time I put on a fabulous outfit and strut into the office. I know work clothes are a drag for a lot of women, so I want to help professional women be as excited about getting dressed for work as I am. I am dedicated to learning each subscriber's personal style, likes and dislikes to ensure customer satisfaction each time a new box is opened. The way you present yourself with what you wear to work has a huge impact on how people perceive you as an employee and Cubicle Queen is here to help you dress for the job you want.

Cubicle Queen is not only a place for fashion guidance in the workplace, it is also a community where women can be inspired by not only stylish clothes, but also by each other. We encourage our subscribers to post their own outfits and success stories to our Facebook page and the most inspiring stories will be featured on our blog. The threads on your body are not the only thing that matters when striving for success, however it's a very fun start.

By signing up for this services, you will save time and money on buying new clothes for work and will be able to apply more time towards getting that raise and more money towards your next vacation.

The money you donate on this account will go towards building the initial closet for Cubicle Queen and your very own first box if you choose to be a subscriber. We are also accepting donations of any size as well if you want to contribute but are not ready to commit to a box. Thank you for the support!!

story:
Great day with BETH STERN as we donated 500 blankets to North Shore Animal League America . She really showed tremendous support for our efforts here at Kona Benellie Designs - Creators of the Throwbee which inspires us to do even more. This is our third blanket donation to this fine organization and they use our blankets everyday to care for and nurture the wonderful animals that await their forever home.

From creating the 'throwbee' to helping shelter dogs

Armed with a giant scissor and a desire to solve a comfort problem, I created the functional and fashionable “throwbee” which keeps us warm front and back while leaving our hands free. There was nothing out there like it. The wearable blanket market was in need of a classy, simple solution and the throwbee meets that need. It can go from living room to soccer field and be used as either a true-blanket or a wearable-blanket. Celebrities, kids, teens, and people of all ages enjoy the freedom, softness, and comfort of the throwbee.

During the spring of 2014, upon a visit to my local animal shelter, I noticed that the pups had very little to bring them comfort and security. I discovered that BLANKETS are at the TOP of shelter wish lists nationwide. This is where I can help make a difference so I immediately evolved my company into a social enterprise that matches each customer purchase with a new blanket given a shelter dog in need. One for one. We have already made many blanket donations to rescues and shelters across the country and have received recognition from the press and from people like Beth Stern, (animal advocate and wife of Howard Stern). But the journey has only just begun for my company. People love comfort and shelter animals need blankets. With over 115 million US households, worldwide market potential, and over 7 million animals that enter into shelters nationwide each year, my little company can make a difference by bringing comfort to people and shelter dogs one purchase at a time. IT'S TIME FOR US TO GROW!





AN INDIEGOGO  E X C L U S I  V E  ! ! !



THE THROWBEE DIFFERENCE :-)

THROWBEE and KONA PET BLANKET COLORS:

story:
CUSTOMIZE YOUR OWN TEE AND SUPPORT THE ARTISTIC COMMUNITY


Are you tired of wearing the same mass-produced tee like everyone else in the public?

Are you unhappy with uncomfortable, common and boring tees that don't last long or the colors fade only after a few washes?

Are you fed up with stores giving you fixed designs and absolutely no other choices to express who you really are?

Have you ever bought a custom-printed polyester tee only to receive a product with printing flaws and imperfections?


The OART-Tee (Original Art Tee) can be customized to your own design, doesn't fade, is premium quality, and is made by properly compensated workers.

By choosing your own tee design, you are also helping supporting emerging artists.




Very Cool Artist Inspired OART-Tees!

A collection of amazing and eye-popping designs by our artists.

Over 10,000 other amazing artist-inspired designs you can check out, customize and own today!


THE OART-TEE A Fusion of Art, Design and Fashion


What makes the OART-Tee different?


Uniqueness
Every OART-Tee is a work of art and one of a kind in the world. You can choose the artwork you want, and can fully customize both the front and the back of your personal tee. You can expand, reduce and move the artwork around the tee, so that you get a great looking tee exactly the way you like it.

Premium Quality
We use only premium quality 100% soft luxurious cotton which lasts longer and can reproduce the artwork properly. Oh, and we use NO harmful chemicals and NO dye sublimation printing!

Social Equality
Over 99% of all T-shirts and T-shirt blanks in the world are mass-produced. Unfortunately, some of these tees are produced in sweatshops; where poor and uneducated workers slaved away in unbelievable working conditions to produce low-quality and low-cost tees. We do not mass-produce (but employ and properly compensate) skilled workers to customize the production of every single tee.



High-End Production
Most screen, digital and dye sublimation printing are done on a mass factory-produced t-shirt blanks, with severe limitations on high-resolution all over printing. Our production methodology ensures a high-resolution, digital quality image that does not fade - even after many washes, and we use environmentally friendly dyes.

Support the Artistic Community
Each OART-Tee is a work of art, literally! We have a very talented global artists and designers in our community who have uploaded well over 15,000 pieces of original artwork and designs, for you to choose for your tee that will delight, mesmerize and wow you!

Customization
Unlike mass-produced tees that you can get in department stores or even on some very high-end boutiques, we can confidently guarantee you that each OART-Tee will be different due to its unique production, customization and individualized tailoring.

All-Over Printing
The world's first integrated sleeves, showing the ENTIRE artwork; one of the challenges wit all-over printing on cotton is that the different printed images on the front, back and sleeves will shrink unevenly during the color fixation and steam cleaning stage.



Our newly designed Integrated Sleeves (no seams!) allows the artwork and design to be clearly displayed on both the front and the back of the tee in one great looking, unbroken and continuous image.

THE RESULT... you own a super unique OART-Tee you love and it is guaranteed to be one of a kind in the world!

Immerse yourself into the creative process and unleash your artistic genius today!

YAY! Kick A@@!







Fashionable and Trendy

Make your personal art fashion statement today!



Having Fun and Looking Cool

Have a great time and look fabulous!






Accessorize and Look Even Cooler

Accessorize with your favorite gear and look even better!




The OART-Tee Difference

Why pay good money to look like everyone else?

Every single OART-Tee is a work of art and simply one of a kind in the world.

Unlike mass produced tees that you can get in department stores or even very high-end boutiques, we can confidently guarantee that each OART-Tee will be different due to its unique production, customization and individualized tailoring.

Even if two OART-Tees were designed with exactly the same look and size, there will be subtle differences. Like twins, they may look somewhat similar, but each OART-Tee will be special and distinctive in its own right.

You will never have the embarrassment of seeing someone else wearing an exact duplicate of your OART-Tee on Planet Earth, GUARANTEED!

Oh, 100% soft luxurious cotton, NO harmful chemicals and NO dye sublimation printing!

A Necessary Luxury!






Our Impact

How we help Artists

We believe that every artist is a special, extraordinary and gifted individual; and their brand of art or design, whether created by hand or in a digital format represents a beautiful and exclusive creation that flows from their creative mind, artistic hands and a passionate heart.

OART-Tee provides each and every artist a level playing field in our global online platform. We provide every artist an equal opportunity, not only to share their creativity with the world through wearable art but also to create an on-going income to provide for their family and loved ones.





Art and Fashion Fusion

OART-Tee will change the way the world views Art and Fashion forever.

We empower the consumer to be innovative, involved and to co-create with their favorite artist something truly personal, stunning and inspirational.

You no longer have to be restrained by the limited choices you are offered in clothing stores. Your imagination is now your only limit.

Everyone now has the power to create wearable art that is truly exquisite, extraordinary and only one of a kind in the world.






Your Limited Edition Campaign Gift

For donations of $10, you will receive ONE of these Exclusive and Super Cool Limited Edition Campaign microfiber cleaning cloth (24cm x 19cm).

For donations of $25 or more, you will receive THREE of these Limited Edition cleaning cloths, one of each design.

You will receive one of these Limited Edition campaign gift with every OART-Tee.

You can use this large cleaning cloth for your TV, laptop, computer, tablet, and smart phone screens. You can also use this cloth for your glass ornaments, mirrors, spectacles, sunglasses and car's windscreen.






How we help the Community, the Environment and our Animal Friends

We strongly believe and are committed in making a real difference in the world. We have a strong culture of caring for the community, environment and wildlife.

We believe that supporting and caring for our disadvantaged communities, being environmentally responsible and helping our animal friends are all worthy causes to invest in.





Fulfillment

As OART-Tee is already an established online business, there is no risk to our supporters for our Rewards Fulfillment. After the campaign ends, we will do some logistics planning to ensure that we get the rewards out to our backers as soon as we can.

We will send you instructions on how to design and customize your very personal OART-Tee.

The Rewards Fulfillment for the Individual and Group donations will be activated 30 days after the campaign ends, and all rewards should be finalized and products received by our backers before the end of August 2015 (barring any unexpected issues), possibly a lot earlier.

For the Biz Packs, we will work directly with our backers immediately after the campaign to create the required designs and branding for their distribution channels. It is anticipated that all the Rewards Fulfillment for the Biz Packs will be received by the end of October or early November 2015; ready for Christmas Season.

We will keep you informed of our production schedule details on our regular updates.





Vincent Ang
Founder, Managing Director

Vincent has a strong passion to connect the global art community, bring artistic inspiration to life and share this creative diversity with the world through one of a kind in the world wearable art. By partnering directly with artists, Vincent wants to provide a positive and exciting environment to help artists express and create their personal and exclusive brand of art apparels.



Karsten Mouras
Artist, Operations Manager

Karsten is an accomplished and talented artist who loves to paint. She uses her art to connect, encourage, inspire and heal. Karsten is an integral part of the original pioneer and management team since the business' inception in 2013. Karsten is in charge of the creative and artistic direction, working with artist community, social media management and communications.



Mandy Kam
Product Development Manager

Mandy has been in the garment and apparel industry for over 20 years, working with big global brands such as Calvin Klein, DKNY, J. Crew, Ann Taylor, Zara and Country Road. She has extensive industry knowledge and has worked on significant projects around the world, from the United States to Europe to Asia. Mandy is in charge of our new product development, quality control, production and distribution.



Henry Yeung
Digital Strategy Manager

Henry is a seasoned digital marketing professional with over 10 years’ experience. He founded the Muse Group Limited in 2012 and worked as its managing director. Henry was the former digital director for Cohn and Wolfe Impact Asia, a former senior business development manager for Guru Online in which he won the coveted Digital Agency of the Year in Hong Kong. Henry is in charge of advising, developing and managing the digital marketing strategy, public relations and working with the media.



Cyril Poon
Technical Manager

Cyril is an experienced system architect with over 12 years of experience working with corporate clients such as HSBC, AIA, Tencent, Shenzhen Airlines, Chinachem Group, both in Hong Kong as well as mainland China. He has a solid background in project management, software development, web systems and embedded systems. In addition to his impressive career achievements, Cyril is also an accomplished musician and a member of the prestigious New Tune Chinese Orchestra.





Vincent has a deep love and appreciation for all types of art. He loves the creative energy that goes into a piece of original art, where an idea is lovingly transformed into reality.

Vincent first learned about the personal challenges, the years of sacrifices and the tough challenges and struggles faced by many new artists; when he first met and spoke with his wife’s uncle, AH TEE ANG.

Ang is a renowned national artist in Singapore and is a highly decorated recipient of the Cultural Medallion award, the highest accolade awarded for artistic excellence in Singapore. His work is widely recognized, sold at Christies Auctions and proudly displayed at the United Nations, the Singapore Changi Airport, hotel chains and in the private collection of the Sultan of Brunei.

When Vincent discovered “all over printing” in 2012, he saw the possibilities of wearable art providing an opportunity to unify artists globally, give them hope for a future, let them run their own business and provide an international platform to share their creation.

The “all over printed” technology was very new back then and only a few companies were offering dye sublimation printing on blank polyester t-shirts.

Vincent decided to buy some dye sublimated printed t-shirts for himself. He quickly discovered that although they looked good on the surface, there were significant quality flaws and found many people preferring cotton to polyester.

He strongly believed that an artist will not create a masterpiece of their work on a cheap medium; hence he sourced the best quality cotton medium and the best and most vibrant inks for artists to showcase their work on.

Together with a business partner in Europe, Vincent co-developed a new production process, and together they created the OART-Tee.

Art and Fashion Fusion
OART-Tee will change the way the world views Art and Fashion forever.
We empower the consumer to be innovative, involved and to co-create with their favorite artist something truly personal, stunning and inspirational.
You no longer have to be restrained by the limited choices you are offered in clothing stores. Your imagination is now your only limit.
Everyone now has the power to create wearable art that is truly exquisite, extraordinary and only one of a kind in the world.










Your Limited Edition Campaign Gift
For donations of $10, you will receive ONE of these Exclusive and Super Cool Limited Edition Campaign microfiber cleaning cloth (24cm x 19cm).
For donations of $25 or more, you will receive THREE of these Limited Edition cleaning cloths, one of each design.
You will receive one of these Limited Edition campaign gift with every OART-Tee.
You can use this large cleaning cloth for your TV, laptop, computer, tablet, and smart phone screens. You can also use this cloth for your glass ornaments, mirrors, spectacles, sunglasses and car's windscreen.





How we help the Community, the Environment and our Animal Friends
We strongly believe and are committed in making a real difference in the world. We have a strong culture of caring for the community, environment and wildlife.
We believe that supporting and caring for our disadvantaged communities, being environmentally responsible and helping our animal friends are all worthy causes to invest in.







Fulfillment
As OART-Tee is already an established online business, there is no risk to our supporters for our Rewards Fulfillment. After the campaign ends, we will do some logistics planning to ensure that we get the rewards out to our backers as soon as we can.
We will send you instructions on how to design and customize your very personal OART-Tee.
The Rewards Fulfillment for the Individual and Group donations will be activated 30 days after the campaign ends, and all rewards should be finalized and products received by our backers before the end of August 2015 (barring any unexpected issues), possibly a lot earlier.
For the Biz Packs, we will work directly with our backers immediately after the campaign to create the required designs and branding for their distribution channels. It is anticipated that all the Rewards Fulfillment for the Biz Packs will be received by the end of October or early November 2015; ready for Christmas Season.
We will keep you informed of our production schedule details on our regular updates.






Vincent Ang
Founder, Managing Director
Vincent has a strong passion to connect the global art community, 
bring artistic inspiration to life and share this creative diversity with the world through one of a kind in the world wearable art. By partnering directly with artists, Vincent wants to provide a positive and exciting environment to help artists express and create their personal and exclusive brand of art apparels.



Karsten Mouras
Artist, Operations Manager
Karsten is an accomplished and talented artist who loves to paint. 
She uses her art to connect, encourage, inspire and heal. Karsten is an integral part of the original pioneer and management team since the business' inception in 2013. Karsten is in charge of the creative and artistic direction, working with artist community, social media management and communications.



Mandy Kam
Product Development Manager
Mandy has been in the garment and apparel industry for over 20 years, working with big global brands such as Calvin Klein, DKNY, J. Crew, Ann Taylor, Zara and Country Road. She has extensive industry knowledge and has worked on significant projects around the world, from the United States to Europe to Asia. Mandy is in charge of our new product development, quality control, production and distribution.


Henry Yeung
Digital Strategy Manager
Henry is a seasoned digital marketing professional with over 10 years’ experience. He founded the Muse Group Limited in 2012 and worked as its managing director. Henry was the former digital director for Cohn and Wolfe Impact Asia, a former senior business development manager for Guru Online in which he won the coveted Digital Agency of the Year in Hong Kong. Henry is in charge of advising, developing and managing the digital marketing strategy, public relations and working with the media.


Cyril Poon
Technical Manager
Cyril is an experienced system architect with over 12 years of experience working with corporate clients such as HSBC, AIA, Tencent, Shenzhen Airlines, Chinachem Group, both in Hong Kong as well as mainland China. He has a solid background in project management, software development, web systems and embedded systems. In addition to his impressive career achievements, Cyril is also an accomplished musician and a member of the prestigious New Tune Chinese Orchestra.





Vincent has a deep love and appreciation for all types of art. He loves the creative energy that goes into a piece of original art, where an idea is lovingly transformed into reality.
Vincent first learned about the personal challenges, the years of sacrifices and the tough challenges and struggles faced by many new artists; when he first met and spoke with his wife’s uncle, AH TEE ANG.
Ang is a renowned national artist in Singapore and is a highly decorated recipient of the Cultural Medallion award, the highest accolade awarded for artistic excellence in Singapore. His work is widely recognized, sold at Christies Auctions and proudly displayed at the United Nations, the Singapore Changi Airport, hotel chains and in the private collection of the Sultan of Brunei.

When Vincent discovered “all over printing” in 2012, he saw the possibilities of wearable art providing an opportunity to unify artists globally, give them hope for a future, let them run their own business and provide an international platform to share their creation.
The “all over printed” technology was very new back then and only a few companies were offering dye sublimation printing on blank polyester t-shirts.
Vincent decided to buy some dye sublimated printed t-shirts for himself. He quickly discovered that although they looked good on the surface, there were significant quality flaws and found many people preferring cotton to polyester.
He strongly believed that an artist will not create a masterpiece of their work on a cheap medium; hence he sourced the best quality cotton medium and the best and most vibrant inks for artists to showcase their work on.
Together with a business partner in Europe, Vincent co-developed a new production process, and together they created the OART-Tee.

story:
UPDATE!!


What's in it for you? 

The Rewards

We've added in a reward chart so you can easily choose the one you like the most. If there's a specific combination of rewards that you'd like which we haven't listed below, you could choose the Make-it-yourself bundle, or just contribute the sum of all the products you'd like, and mail us with your requirements.


NOTE : The INR rates listed are approximations and could vary based on the daily exchange rates.

Hi there! I'm Shivani, the founder of Arture. Like most great things, Arture started out of a flash of inspiration - a light bulb moment! I was aching to create products that would be luxurious, while being harmless to our world at the same time. And just like that, Arture was born.

Arture is about art and nature uniting as one. Nature holds within it so many beautiful secrets and Arture is on a mission to rediscover those secrets and bring them to you. The world around me never stops surprising me, and Arture is my canvas of nature! 

Why Cork?



The Products


The Colours


Features


We use 100% organic fabrics for all our linings, made with natural dyes and hand-painted Batik work, sourced locally in India.


Manufacturing

We manufacture locally in Chennai, India at a small unit of skilled workers. Our technician, Subramanian, is immensely talented and helps bring all our designs to life. His technical expertise helps shape our designs and make our products what they are. 

Stretch Goals


Why does it take us so long to deliver?

We know you want to get your hands on the products as soon as you possibly can, and August might seem like a long wait, but here's why we need that time :

- Our campaign runs for 45 days, at the end of which Indiegogo will release the funds to us. This means it'll be the end of April by the time be receive the funds.

- We will then order all our raw materials from across the world and we expect to receive everything by the third week of April

- We have then approximated 2 months to produce all our wallets, and 3 months for the bags. 

- We have included some buffer time to ship the products.

We hope to ship earlier than the dates we have listed but we do not want to make promises we can't keep. We want to stick to our word and get you beautiful products with no compromises. Thank you so much for understanding!! :)

People we'd like to thank

We would never have reached this far if not for the amazing team we had. Aside from the core team, we'd like to thank a bunch of people for the helping us out and being a part of our project. 

  • Harish Ravichandran and Dhanush Nayanar for editing and VFX
  • Aditya Patel, Shruthi Swaminathan, Oyindrila Ray Ghosh, Amal Siby Allencherry, Tejaswini Shrikanth and Adithya Das for being a part of the video and being so awesome!
  • S. Krishnan for all the work he put in and for providing us with cost sheets and whatever else we needed at the drop of a hat! 
  • The many many people who filled our surveys and gave us their feedback right when Arture was just a seed. These people encouraged us to take it further.

None of this would have been possible without the support of all these guys! :)

Shipping

We ship worldwide! 

We provide FREE SHIPPING WITHIN INDIA.

For International backers, please add the required amount for shipping as listed in the perk descriptions. If you forgot to add shipping, select the $2 perk, and use it to contribute the required amount.

Please note that you are responsible for any taxes, fees or duties applicable to your region.

Risks & Challenges

As with any product, there is always a risk of incurring delays in the acquiring of materials from our suppliers and the production by our manufacturer. We have developed good relationships with all our suppliers and have spoken to them in advance about the timelines that we are working on. Since all the sampling is already complete, the manufacturer is familiar with all the products and their constructions, and we hope not to encounter that hurdle. If we do encounter any such obstacles, we will be sure to keep our backers informed and work hard at resolving it as soon as possible.

FAQs

How do I choose multiple rewards that aren't part of the bundles (or) How do I make my own bundle?
Simply choose the $300 Make-It-Yourself reward, and let us know what products you want. Alternately, you can choose the most expensive of the rewards that you want, and then enter in the sum of all the products you want. 
How do I calculate international shipping when I am selecting multiple rewards?
If you are picking multiple rewards a-la-carte, simply add the shipping cost of each of them into your contribution amount.
How do I choose the colour that I want?
In the description of each product we have listed the alternate colour ways. You can pick your favourite and we will mail you to find out your colour preferences before we go into production.
Need any other help?
Don't worry. Just reach out to us at hello@arture.in and we will be happy to answer your queries.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love Arture, do help us make some noise. Join the Arture revolution on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. Your support means the word to us.


Love,
The Arture Team

www.arture.in

story:
The Story

Born out of a desire to live outside the traditional box of beauty, Rocket + Lace is not only a company, but a lifestyle brand inspired by living out unique passions, finding beauty in freedom, and accepting whatever it is that you want to be -- all while empowering others to do the same. Perfectly combining two traditionally “opposite” visions of beauty, Rocket + Lace’s visionary style incorporates the rough and edgy alongside the delicate and elegant, creating unique, hand made pieces that make wearers feel like their favorite version of themselves.

Officially launched on March 23rd, 2013 with their handmade hair accessories, Rocket + Lace has been building on their success by growing into a full suite of handmade vests, jackets and t-shirts, each hand designed and tailored by Anna, founder of R + L. 

The vision does not stop at exceptional and unique denim outerwear. The future of Rocket + Lace is to become more than a brand, but a lifestyle and a community of individuals seeking beauty in their unique stories. 


The Campaign

The $27,000 we are raising will go directly towards fueling Rocket + Lace's creative journey.

Including:

  • creative development + marketing
  • printing the new line
  • opening a mobile storefront to continue sharing the message of being free in who you are

Join the lifestyle + share the story

Let's start a Beautiful Riot.

story:
Lean On Him Apparel: Origins

  • My name is Brandon Powell from Dallas, TX; I am the oldest of 5
  • I feel this Apparel line is meant for me to do 
  • I've always had a natural talent for drawing & creativity
  • I pick up on being fashion savvy from my mom
  • I hope to raise funds for starting my Apparel line in the Dallas Metroplex
  • I remember how much positive feedback I received when I shared the concepts with my friends and associates
  • I loved hearing customer's response when they purchased items for their daughters, mothers, and family members
  • The contribution you provide will help me build my business into a franchise template
  • I hope to expand to multiple locations across the Texas area and then nationally
  • I plan to create job opportunities for those in need
  • I hope to use this Apparel line as a means to create a legacy for my family and those who work in my company

What I Need & What You Get

The 3,000 will help to cover the costs:

  • The equipment for pressing the T-shirts and other garment materials
  • Purchasing the inventory: T-Shirts, Polos, Dress Shirts
  • Production costs for printing Clothes: Over 25 items in stock
  • My lease agreement and fees to property management
  • If I am not able to reach my entire funding goal, I will use the funds collected to purchase some inventory and plan for upgrading equipment when affordable
  • I will offer special discounts on all of my products to those who contribute
  • I am also a Graphic Designer; I will offer free design services such as business cards, flyers, banners, and more!

The Impact

  • I feel this Apparel line is unique an special to the retail market
  • I have spent the last 8 months getting market feedback to harness my design and brand
  • When I did a soft launch of the clothing line, I sold over to almost everyone in my department at my job!
  • I quickly notice how well, youth and "seasoned" adults could identify with the products
  • I was overjoyed when a customer told me her husband when my product everyday now!

Risks & Challenges

I may face challenges with sales because this is a new brand of clothing. I could be faced with the risk of not having enough sales to cover my expenses

  • I keep an open ear to my customer feedback to ensure I am providing the best customer experience
  • I have a business philosophy I live by: Reflect, Reassess, Execute
  • I keep a steady habit of reading audio books in "Audible" app in my Android phone to keep improving my knowledge base
  • I attend at least 1-3 business related workshops to receive hands on training and build new relationships with like-minded entrepreneurs
  • I plan to use income receive my consulting company to help stabilize my times of stagnation in sales

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Truth be told, I know I am not the only one out there with a big dream to be a successful entrepreneur
  • You may have your own friends, family, & associates you are already supporting and cannot contribute to my endeavors
  • If that be the case, I express my appreciation for taking the time to listen to my story; believe it or not, it means a lot to know you were at least willing to do that
  • For those who can contribute or support, please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to help in spreading the word!

story:
ABOUT ME…

Hi guys!  My name is Kellia Reed and I am a graphic artist & computer illustrator from New Jersey.  I am very passionate about all genres of art especially graphic design, anime, and manga art culture.  In result, I love creating urban themed graphic and anime inspired illustrations combining my hand drawing skill and computer drawing programs.  I also have a freelance graphic illustration and design business in which I assist and advise my clients on how to create their own creative works.

I am also a single mom to an amazing 3 year old son, Kaden.  Recently, my son and I were involved in a serious car accident in which timing and what I believe was God’s protection pretty much saved our lives; still I got banged up pretty bad. I experienced how life literally can be taken away in just a moment and realized that there is no time like the present to accomplish whatever it is that I want to do.  My ambition is to share my art with the world so I created a logo, converted my artwork into graphics, and decided to start a wearable art collection.

THE DOPE MOVEMENT…

DEFINED DOPENESS will be a unisex apparel collection in which I plan on using apparel pieces as the canvas for my artwork.  Instead of just selling print work or using fine art materials as a medium, why not utilize something that everyone needs and can use and reuse?  I see apparel as a moving canvas.  Most works of art are placed somewhere stationary and I don’t want that.  I want my artwork to be seen as much as it can be.  The complexity of the each illustration and printing style will all depend on how much money I can contribute to each design for production.  First production will consist of just t-shirts based on my main logo (to get the brand out) and a couple of my anime illustrations utilizing different printing and ink techniques. The goal is to release a new piece every 3-6 months.  As my funds grow, ultimately I would like to branch out into fleece goods and more cut & sewn pieces along with different types of trim such as appliques, embroidery, custom woven labels, etc.  I also plan on using social media as sort of a lifestyle platform in which I will assist my customers on how to coordinate my apparel pieces with other articles of clothing they may already have or are looking to purchase.

HOW YOU MAY HELP…

Here is where I need your help. Humbly I am asking for your generosity to help me raise $5,000 to complete my first production.  Below is the breakdown on how I plan to use all funds raised:

LEGAL + BUSINESS CARDS

First and foremost, approximately 15% of proposed funding will be used for legal purposes to register or trademark my logo.  The last thing I ever want, as any artist can agree with, is for someone to see my work and try to copy my ideas. Therefore I must protect myself and already have a business lawyer to do so.  Once my logo is in the works to be legalized, I plan on printing new business cards.


WHOLESALE + PRODUCTION + PACKAGING + DISTRIBUTION + PROMOTION

The remaining 85% of funds will be divided between purchasing wholesale t-shirts, ink, outsourced printing, production, packaging, distribution, and promotion.  For my basic logo t-shirts, I plan on doing the printing myself at a local print shop, Newark Print Shop, which is why I would need to purchase ink.  But I also want to explore as many printing techniques as I can which is why I will be using additional printing services.  The more detailed oriented illustrations and printing techniques I can produce, the better for my vision.  I plan on selling my first collection personally, through social media utilizing PayPal or cash, the Etsy website, and bigcartel.com. Each purchase will be wrapped and fastened with a custom DEFINED DOPENESS sticker that I will also print myself.  With each purchase I plan on including a personalized invoice, and a small card with my logo and a personal thank you to each customer.  As my funds grow, the ultimate goal is to build a DEFINED DOPENESS cut & sewn apparel line and lifestyle brand.


If I do not raise the proposed amount of $5000, I will use the funds I do receive to produce as much as I can. I still plan on legalizing my logo first because I feel that is most important and I will then take it step by step until I reach my goals.


PERKS (THE COLLECTION – FIRST PRODUCTION GOALS

 


THE IMPACT OF YOUR GENEROSITY…

Honestly, I just cannot do this alone.  My life does not afford me the extra funds to get my goals to the next level, especially being a single mom with other financial responsibilities, mostly repaying student loans.  It really is that challenging but I want the opportunity to share my art in my own way. I want the freedom to be an entrepreneur, work on my own time and most importantly to have more time with my son.  I know I have the talent to be successful; I have been sharing my artwork through print since 2009 and people have really responded positively and have always inquired if I were going to start a t-shirt collection or sell my prints.  So not only is this for me but for those who have supported me all these years.  The same people who trust me to help them with their own creative projects.  For example, I have been working with a non-profit and one t-shirt I designed for Cancer awareness has raised over $6.5k to date.  I am also a graphic designer by day and have been creating licensed artwork for major sports leagues for 3 years now.

I am also a firm believer of giving back to the community.  From every purchase, I plan to donate 10% to Fashion For A Cure (FFAC), www.fashionforacure.org , a non-profit organization I support which uses fashion to help raise money to increase education and support for families affected by Heart Disease and Cancer and is also a platform intended to motivate people to give back to their communities.

THE CHALLENGES…

Of course with starting any new business venture, especially a creative one, there will be risks.  Printing and production could not be as per my standards and I have to reprint, the apparel could not sell as well as I would hope, or I just run out of money and cannot move forward in the direction I’d like.  One of my biggest personal challenges will be establishing a client base beyond my friends and family and competition with other apparel lines.  I am constantly viewing other apparel collections that could possibly be competition for my genre of artwork and have found a good number of collections that could be considered similar.  The challenge will be whether or not my apparel collection stands out amongst them.  I have no idea of the answer but I believe in myself and my art and will get my apparel out to as many people as I can by establishing a solid customer base from selling, word of mouth, and social media.

OTHER WAYS YOU MAY HELP….

Even if you cannot contribute monetarily, you can still help out.  Please, share my campaign with your friends and family or with anyone you think would enjoy my apparel or may believe in my campaign and would like to help me out.  You can follow my artist page on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter or you can always send me an email if you would like to know more about myself and my work.  Every little bit helps and I graciously accept any way you are willing to assist.

 

Thank you for the time dedicated to reading my campaign, supporting me, and sharing my story with others… Love is love!
